dialogues.speaker: THE EARTH
dialogues.text: spins in mortal turmoil. A vast spinner of clouds the siz Australia approaches the west coast of North America, lightning flashing, thunder BELLOWING and CRACKLING. The glows red and purple, angry and crazy. This is the planet made Gothic by human intervention.

dialogues.speaker: SEATTLE
dialogues.text: is buffeted by hundred-and-fifty-mile-an-hour winds. Plat glass shatters and explodes.

dialogues.speaker: SAN FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: quakes before the raging wind. A giant tsunami surges tow the great suspension bridge. When it passes, cables have wrenched, untwining, and collapse appears imminent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city is a swamp, some buildings on dry ground, others below sea level. Far south and east of its northern cousi the full thrust of the storm has not struck Los Angeles y Smoke from open fires trail skyward like ghosts and sprea along the ceiling of the sky even as it bleeds rain everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: A TEN-YEAR-OLD GIRL, (MANDY)
dialogues.text: runs, terrified, down a decayed city street. She clutches something in her dirt-caked hands, holds it dear to her breast. The girl slides around a corner on her bottom, stares bac

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: seems derelict. A flash of lightning reveals men scurryin like rats after her.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 2.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME AND FOLLOW MANDY, (A MONTAGE)
dialogues.text: as she turns and scrambles away. Her pursuers follow her everywhere — around rusting cars, through an abandoned MT bus, and across the rubble of a building that once dispen happy meals and toys. Mandy dives into a burrow beneath piled debris. One of the men walks directly toward her. Another scurries, chortling madly, around to her side. A third man approaches from behind. Mandy clutches her prize ever-more tightly and prays that they don't see her. They do. The leader lifts Mandy from the debris, her naked legs dangling from beneath her torn dress.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD RAT
dialogues.text: Lookit what I got! Mandy struggles and screams. Lead Rat covers her mouth. Limping Rat snatches the prize from her fingers: A dinner roll, hard as a rock and twice as filthy.

dialogues.speaker: LIMPING RAT
dialogues.text: So that's what you're hiding, little girl? Don't you want to share? You want to share, right? Mandy writhes free enough to say:

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: Take it! Take it! Just... leave me alone! Chortling Rat arrives. His fingers pinch Mandy's leg.

dialogues.speaker: CHORTLING RAT
dialogues.text: This little girl's plump. Lead Rat drops her to the ground, assesses her.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD RAT
dialogues.text: You got family, girl... with anything to trade? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 3.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mandy understands immediately.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes, my daddy's got canned goods. And gasoline. Lead Rat thinks about this. The dinner roll lying abandon nearby suggests not.

dialogues.speaker: CHORTLING RAT
dialogues.text: She'd feed us for a week!

dialogues.speaker: LIMPING RAT
dialogues.text: (grinning, of Chortling Rat as he assesses girl) I dunno... You still on that diet? Mandy screams and tries to break away. Lead Rat holds her a vise grip. Chortling Rat kneels beside the little girl.

dialogues.speaker: CHORTLING RAT
dialogues.text: (of leader) I never took you for squeamish. That settles it. Lead Rat produces a huge switchblade. It snaps out, steel catching the light. Mandy screams. An arrow slams through Lead Rat's neck. He doesn't move, believing.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GARTH, (35)
dialogues.text: a hard man with hawk eyes now focused on killing. Even th he is a warrior, there is something humane about John Gar He knows there is no glory to what he is doing. His rock- exposed arms hold the bow's tension like the cables of a suspension bridge, and shake with the load. He releases. Lead Rat faces death and drops. Limping Rat is already scurrying away, weapon drawn, when Garth's second arrow catches him. He drops. Chortling Rat, whining fearfully, scuttles around debris, hiding his silhouette. He pulls a nasty looking automatic looks up to find a target when an arrow slams into him. H falls. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 4.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garth drops to the ground, walks to Mandy, who stands suc air like the price is going up.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GARTH
dialogues.text: Your mother's worried. Mandy shakes her head crazily. Yes, I know. Garth kneels beside her. Mandy bursts into his arms. He h her like a father until her sobs diminish.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You shouldn't go out by yourself. Mandy buries her head in his chest, safe now.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: But I'm hungry, John.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I know... Garth releases her and steps past to harvest the arrow th took Lead Rat's life. He takes the switchblade as well. Mandy scurries to where the dinner roll lies and retrieve it. She tries to bite into it. Hard as stone.

dialogues.speaker: BESIDE LIMPING RAT'S CORPSE
dialogues.text: harvests the second arrow, using the switchblade to cut t arrow out. Mandy staggers to Garth's side. She looks yearningly at Limping Rat. Clutching Garth's leg:

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: It would be a waste to just leave them here.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (understanding her meaning) No.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: But I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You stay here. I have to get my other arrow. Garth moves to get the arrow. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 5.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mandy waits nervously near Limping Rat's corpse. When Gar returns, he scoops her up and starts walking away. Looking back from Garth's arms, Mandy's hungry eyes remai the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hovel bandaged with debris. Campfires burn with constant complaint, sizzling embers and hissing wood once shaped by hand. Mist clouds everything. Men and women guard the ramparts, some with guns, some wi bows like Garth's.

dialogues.speaker: A GUARD
dialogues.text: Someone's coming. The men scramble to the walls.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (a shout) John Garth! A moment later Garth enters the camp with Mandy carried o his hip. Mandy's mother rushes to take her into her arms as Garth drops her.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY'S MOM
dialogues.text: Mandy!

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: Look, Mom... I found some bread.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY'S MOM
dialogues.text: Where were you?! I've been worried to death!

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: She's okay. I found her about six blocks south, near Pico.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY'S MOM
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: It's okay. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 6.

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: (showing her prize) Mom! Look, bread!

dialogues.speaker: MANDY'S MOM
dialogues.text: You put that away, now. One of the hunters found meat. We have stew. Garth turns at this information. Meat?

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: Food?! Mommy, I'm so hungry...

dialogues.speaker: MANDY'S MOM
dialogues.text: Come on, sweetheart. I'll get you a bowl. Garth questions this silently, then turns to head for his digs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An often-repaired tent. Garth throws the entry flap back, enters to find his father, MATTHEW, Garth grown older and weaker. He lies in a hammock, recovering from a broken le

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEW
dialogues.text: You're not dead, I see. Storing his equipment:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Not yet. How's the leg?

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEW
dialogues.text: I'm hobbling about. Anything happen out there? Garth turns to survey his father, pulls three cans of Campbell's soup from his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I killed six men... three this morning over these... (presents the cans) ... three tonight over the Parker girl.

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEW
dialogues.text: You found her alive? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 7.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Alive. She wouldn't have stayed that way long... I hear they've got stew. Did anybody bring you some? Matthew snorts.

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEW
dialogues.text: Rodriguez says he killed a deer. Brought the meat in already butchered... There are no deer left in Los Angeles, not even in the canyons. Garth understands. Meat. Of the human variety. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: How 'bout some Campbell's soup? M'M-M'M- Good... (reads labels) Cream of mushroom... chicken noodle... and cream of tomato.

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEW
dialogues.text: (smacking his lips) Chicken noodle. I'll stoke the fire.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: No, dad. I'll take care of it. You stay off that leg. Garth pulls his survival knife and begins to open one of cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth and Matthew lie asleep after their repast, Matthew his hammock, Garth on a bed made of old clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards walk lonely beats behind walls of debris. Suddenly a brilliant light appears in the night sky. A VO from a loudspeaker:

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER VOICE
dialogues.text: You people in the camp... We're looking for John Garth.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 8.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: hovers a hundred yards from the ramparts, its single directional light bouncing from point to point on the wal

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Is he in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth exits his digs. His father hobbles after. A camp citizen climbs to the top of the walls.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP CITIZEN
dialogues.text: He's here... What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER VOICE
dialogues.text: We're coming in. The chopper sets down.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: enter the camp. Two wear LAPD uniforms, the third a long with a detective badge pinned to a lapel, LAPIERE. He's t sort of man who becomes a cop because of one perk — power One of the uniforms carries a cardboard box marked Peache The camp citizens give them a wide berth. Garth stands on row back.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: I'm Detective Lieutenant Oscar LaPiere of the LAPD.

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD
dialogues.text: --. he's no cop... no police anymore... he's lying (etc.)

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: Of course there are police left. (smiling confidently) We're just like you, trying to survive. We help when we can.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You must be pretty busy... elsewhere. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 9.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lapiere's steady grin belies the heat of his eyes directe Garth.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: Where's John Garth?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What do you want with him?

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: I've brought him a gift. Are you John Garth?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What gift? Who sent it? LaPiere allows the question to dangle a moment, then step aside and gestures to the cop holding the crate to set it down.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: Peaches... Name brand, not the store variety... packed in syrup. The gasp of camp citizens suggests this might be gold.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Who sent it?

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: Anton Reich. Garth kneels beside the cardboard box to check the glue seals. Not tampered with.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I take it you're John Garth?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Who's Anton Reich? And what does he want with me? Mandy steps through the crowd and kneels beside the box. is in awe of it.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: He wants to hire you. He instructed me to tell you — this is a signing bonus.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Signing bonus? Then it's not a gift? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 10.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: Oh no. It's yours. No strings. Garth considers that, then tears the box open and hands M a can. She can't suppress her joy. Running to her mother:

dialogues.speaker: MANDY
dialogues.text: Mommy! Mommy! Look what I got!

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: (continuing with restrained disapproval) You can do with it what you will, of course... Mr. Reich just wants to take a meeting with you. Garth removes four cans from the box and gives them to hi father. Taking one can for himself, Garth shoves what rem of the box into the arms of the camp leader.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Share this... (to LaPiere) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter looks shiny new as Garth, LaPiere and the trudge through debris-ridden terrain. Garth uses his surv knife to open the can of peaches.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (of chopper) I didn't think there were any of those left.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised what's left... if you know the right people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper flies through the rainy night. Garth pushes the can lid back and drinks thirstily before lifting a peach slice out and swallowing it whole, like a bear with a fish just caught from a stream. LaPiere looks with amusement. Garth sees his look, offers the can.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: No thank you. I've eaten. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 11.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garth shrugs, digs out another fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights work, even if the sign has been damaged: UCL(A M(ed) ICAL CEN(t)ER. The chopper sets down. Garth, Lapiere and the attending cops exit and make for t big hospital building as Garth tosses the empty can of peaches into an empty wire receptacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth, LaPiere and the uniformed cops make their way into building, which obviously is no longer in use as a hospit Even though it appears abandoned, the lights work. Garth stops to look around. He hasn't seen electric light months.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What's powering these lights?

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: (moving him along) Mr. Reich has his residence on the top floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An immense open bay. At one end are stacked platform afte platform of canned goods, ammunition, oil, military weapo in cases, liquor, medical supplies. At the opposite end, mansion in miniature with unblemished furniture, Persian carpets, drapes over the windows, stands of famous artwor paintings, sculpture, and a huge oak desk stolen, certain from a rich man's office. Men in uniform stand guard beside the elevator door, one LAPD, the second MTA. One uniform is as good as another, apparently The elevator opens. Garth and LaPiere exit, followed by t two cops.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON REICH
dialogues.text: is a man of formidable countenance. 50, he wears clothes in better times might be considered obscenely expensive. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 12.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: is a leader, a manipulator, and a salesman. He approaches Garth as if welcoming an important client, extending a ha

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Major Garth, welcome. Anton Reich. Garth surveys him briefly, the proffered hand, then turns gaze to the cops.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't worry. They're not really police. They work for me now. Garth's gaze continues to the flats of canned goods and o supplies.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you hungry, Major?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Oh no, I just finished dinner. Steak and lobster, a good chardonnay, and chocolate mousse for dessert.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: (amused) Better than my table, I'm afraid. But I can have my cook whip up something... Major?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I'm not a major.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: No, of course not. Not anymore. Who of us have titles these days?... Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: It's Lieutenant, Mr. Reich.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Mr. Garth and I will have dinner in the residence. See to it.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Lapiere turns and moves for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: (to cops) You two may leave as well. The two cops follow LaPiere. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 13.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Reich takes Garth by the arm, and releases him on Garth's look.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: While we're waiting for dinner, can I get you anything else?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Well, Adolph... you can tell me what you want so I can blow this bunker.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Adolph... not such a bad fellow after all, now was he?... I should think simple logic would answer your question. You have nothing I could want — except skill. Obviously, I want to hire you.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I'm not for hire.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm certain that's so. Do you see that flat of canned goods back there? Garth looks. A mountain eight feet by eight feet. A fortu

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had it brought up here just so you could see it. I usually leave food down in the pantry... In any case, there are sixty cases of beef stew, sixty of fruit cocktail, sixty cases of peaches — my favorite, I usually have peaches for dessert — sixty cases of deviled ham, sixty cases of hash, sixty cases of tuna, sixty cases of... well, I can give you a manifest. Garth takes in the vast fortune. He fails to hide his astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you still not for hire, Major Garth? Garth's silence is answer enough.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought so...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Who do you want me to kill? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 14.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Kill? Kill?! Killing is easy, Major. What I want you to do is much harder. Care for a brandy? Reich opens a fresh bottle of Courvoisier, almost fills t snifters, turns to hand one to Garth.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: stands before one of a dozen paintings, many recognizable but not this. It's a map of the earth with a vast storm, unlike the Red Spot of Jupiter, swirling across the world Reich presents Garth with a brandy.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: You've found my Nilsson. It's magnificent, isn't it? Garth takes the brandy, sniffs, and is snatched into enthralled memories.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's called 'The Blue Spot.' It was painted right after they discovered the storm that circles the surface of the earth, like 'The Red Spot' circles Jupiter, returning again and again, wreaking havoc... Nilsson killed himself right after he completed it.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Suicide doesn't exactly distinguish him, does it?

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: No, not at all. So many people have killed themselves. Still, it's a magnificent piece. Most of these pieces you see here I took into protective custody from the Getty.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I thought I recognized some of them.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Which is why I need you, Major.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I told you. I'm not a major anymore.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 15.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: yanks a tarp from a table miniature of an estate.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Come see this. Garth reluctantly joins him.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you recognize it?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: The Vincent estate.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Yes. It's located across the four-oh-five from the Getty, in the Sepulveda Pass. It's nearly as big, too. Are you familiar with Vincent?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Just that he's rich.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Was rich. No one's seen him in years. He's probably dead. Still, his estate remains operative... You may have wondered how it is that we have electric lights here, elevators that work and so on, when the rest of the city has been reduced to the stone age. It's because UCLA has a nuke in the basement. It was installed for educational purposes, but it's large enough to supply the entire facility with power... Reich searches Garth's eyes for understanding. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vincent installed a duplicate in his estate. It's fully automated, powering a specially designed security system. Vincent intended to convert his estate into a museum on his death, but the world fell apart first. I want you to break in, Major... break in and shut down Vincent's nuke, so I can take all of Vincent's art into protective custody. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 16.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (cynical grin) Protective custody?

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Oh hell, I could call it stealing, but the truth is, it'll only be in my hands until I die, and then the next fellow will come along and protect it.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You could say the same thing about gold... (eyes drifting toward the palets of food) -.. while other valuables are consumable.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yes, that's true... So, what do you say? The shadows across Garth's eyes hide deep thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: enjoying a sumptuous meal. Candlesticks, wine, dishes fil with ample portions. Nearby, the table miniature.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: -.. thing is, the roof is protected by surface-to-air missiles, SAMs. Anything that comes within a thousand yards of the place is blown up.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You tried it?

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Hm, yes.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Why not assault it from the side?

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: The grounds are protected by miniature battle units — tanks, in reality, although they were manufactured to look like dogs. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 17.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: With just the equipment you have over there... (gestures crates across room) ++. you could take out something like that.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: The entrances are made of six inch armor plate, but we could get past that, too. It was proven during the middle ages that any wall may be breached. No, the problem is, I don't want any of Vincent's collection damaged.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Go in a window, then.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: You make it sound so easy. I hope that it is. A window, yes. The real problem is not getting in, but staying alive once you're there... (on Garth's look) I have much of Vincent's security plans. Some, anyway. He employed a new kind of controller, a sentient computer system.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: The computer reasons? Like a human being?

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Here. Let me show you. Reich removes a notebook computer from a briefcase beside table, opens it. A picture of DIANA LOGAN, 28, appears on screen. Diana is beautiful, yes, but behind her eyes resi an incisive mind and a depth of feeling unusual in one so young.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Twenty years ago this woman, Diana Logan, was dying of cancer. Vincent convinced her to transfer her consciousness into his one-of-a-kind mainframe, which he named EnCrypt. She lives there still, inside Vincent's mansion... a kind of apparition within his computer. Garth studies the face. It reminds him that once flowers bloomed, that there was hope in the world, that people we young and beautiful. He closes the notebook lid. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 18.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: She controls all of the security systems?

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Yes. As well as maintenance and repair. As I said, the Vincent mansion is fully automated.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Is she programmed to kill?

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Oh yes. If necessary.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: How do I defeat her... the system, I mean?

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: You defeat each subsystem separately. But in order to defeat the entire system, you must shut down the reactor. It's located in the basement, along with the supercomputer that controls everything. Obviously, this area presents the greatest challenge.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: There is one additional thing I haven't mentioned yet... research that Vincent was doing... the last copy of which may be in the computer. I want you to download it before shutting the system off.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What kind of research? Reich considers not telling him. He delays, sipping wine, cutting another bite of meat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Vincent was researching weather control... a way to stop the storms — THE STORM — and return the earth to its original weather pattern. Garth laughs. Redemption? It seems absurd. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 19.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You want me to save the world? Reich smiles too.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Yes. Could you please?... It's probably nothing. Vincent is missing and in all likelihood dead, not an indicator for success, is it? Still, even if his research is partially completed...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: stands and walks to the window. The city lights are fires consuming furniture and dreams. Reich joins him.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: The world's dying while you play potentate inside these walls. Hell, it's already dead. What you see out there is nothing more than the death rattle.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: No. What you see out there is a thinning of the herd. From ten billion people to maybe a million... a necessary event... and we who are to survive will need a return to the old weather cycle... and art, too, if we are to remain civilized. Download the data if you can... but shut down that nuke. The SOUND of a firefight some distance away.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My competitor from the South Bay. She pushes north with an army twice the size of mine. She's flush with booty from that shopping center down there, the biggest one in the world. It's made her strong... That's why I'm pulling out, Major, relocating to the Central Coast after the storm passes. I want the Vincent estate before I leave. And I plan to leave the moment the storm clears. That's how much time you'll have, two, maybe three days. After that I blow my way in and take whatever's not destroyed.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 20

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW GARTH AND REICH
dialogues.text: as they walk past the palets of food and supplies.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: I want you to have a good night's sleep... be at your best before you go in... Is there anything I can get you? Companionship, maybe? Garth stops before the eight-by-eight-foot cube of food.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I do nothing... until this is delivered to my camp.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: (laughs) Half. The rest when you come out. Garth gestures assent.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calling) Sergeant LaPiere. The elevator door opens revealing LaPiere and two former cops.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Show the Major to his room... then arrange to have half of this food delivered to his camp. Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is splendidly attired, subtly illuminated. LaPie allows Garth in, then closes the door behind him. Garth begins to remove his clothes. Movement in the corner of the room. A WOMAN steps out of shadows. She is lovely. Her greek gown insinuates that sh possesses nothing else, just this garment. Clearly, this situation is new to her and she's afraid.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: I'm... yours, if you want me. Garth doesn't know what to say. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 21.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The woman releases the gown and it slips away. The strain this, the humiliation, tugs on her expression. She steps to Garth, waiting for him to touch her. She will not cry. But the struggle makes the muscles of her face dance with restrained emotion. Garth pulls the bedspread from the bed and wraps her in i She clutches the garment about herself, thankful. Finally brow finds his chest. She sobs. Garth's arms almost close about her, but he hesitates. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Who were you?

dialogues.speaker: SLAVE
dialogues.text: I was... a CPA. She looks up. Her intelligent eyes search his.

dialogues.speaker: SLAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who were you? The question has many answers. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: A civilized man.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEXT MORNING
dialogues.text: finds the woman asleep beneath the covers, and Garth waki above them. He rises from the bed, begins to dress.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORWAY
dialogues.text: stands just inside, grinning smugly.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: Forget that stuff. We've got new clothes for you. You can even shower, if you want.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SHOWER
dialogues.text: stands beneath the spray of hot water. The feel of it rem him of clean yesterdays.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 22.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKER ROOM
dialogues.text: exits the shower to find a stack of clothes on a bench, a new boots beneath it. He dresses.

dialogues.speaker: RESIDENCE
dialogues.text: observe his notebook computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Have you faced automated defense systems before, Major?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Many times.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Then you know that Vincent Industries supplied much of the world's automated security and combat systems. He made everything from sentry dogs, like these...

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN, (AND INTERCUT AS NECESSARY)
dialogues.text: where the SENTRY DOG lopes onto the screen, then TRANSMOR into an animated blueprint. The animal looks like a large bulldog.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME GARTH AND REICH
dialogues.text: looking at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: (continuous ) +... to more commercial combat platforms. This particular model can be configured as a strictly urban, house protection system, or it can carry weapons. In the case of Vincent's mansion, the dogs are fully armed. We tested the perimeter to find out.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (disdainful) Who went in? LaPiere? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 23.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: No. Unfortunately our man was killed. You knew Captain Leon Vega of the Army Rangers? The name impacts.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I trained him...

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Yes. He mentioned you before he died... Inside the Vincent mansion there are other platforms, several that were on the market, and possibly a number that Vincent was developing but had not yet finalized. Almost certainly you'll find the Ghost. THE GHOST comes up on the screen. It indeed looks like a ghost, a floating apparition, but it has teeth — weapon barrels, which are shown when the device TRANSMORPHS into animated blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It fires a mini-pulse bolt that can both stun and kill, depending on the programming. Other weapon configurations are possible. Its design was intended to scare off intruders first, so there is a mercy factor built in.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Mercy factor...

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: There are other weapons platform possibilities. We've listed all that we know about Vincent Industries equipment in this notebook computer. Take it with you. Familiarize yourself with Vincent's defense mechanisms. My advice, though, is to expect the unexpected. Garth closes the notebook, considering what he has got himself into.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORY
dialogues.text: marvels at the array of weapons and combat paraphernalia organized on shelves and attached to walls. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 24.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Reich and LaPiere watch from nearby as the ARMORER brings what appears to be a metal flak jacket to Garth and fits to him.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: Have you worn force-field body armor before, Major?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: I'm not surprised. It was just introduced during the last days of the Pentagon... Now, it's battery operated. This read- out... He places a WATCH-LIKE DEVICE on Garth's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --. here tells you your count. Generally speaking, the armor is good for approximately a hundred rounds of five- point-five-six, or seventy-five rounds of seven-point-six-two. Grenades and pulse weapons take a toll of anywhere from ten to a hundred points, depending on the proximity of impact. You follow?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I follow.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: Good. Now this is a battery pack. The armorer straps a BATTERY BELT to Garth's waist.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It holds twenty additional batteries. They aren't interconnected for reasons of shorting out or chain reaction. You understand? This armor is electrically operated.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I get the concept.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: You must change the batteries between firefights, or whenever a battery becomes depleted. Some batteries may provide protection past the hundred mark, but don't count on it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 25

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Armorer takes an M-16 off a table and points it at Ga

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Reich and LaPiere) Gentlemen, you may wish to stand back. Glancing rounds will deflect. Reich and LaPiere retreat five paces. Garth can't believe he's about to be shot at. He steps forward... The Armorer BEGINS FIRING. The ROUNDS HIT GARTH repeatedl until the magazine empties. EACH ROUND HITTING THE BODY A CAUSES IT TO 'FLASH' AS IT REPELS THE FIREPOWER. The Armorer switches magazines as Garth, angered and surprised, attempts to march forward again and take the g from the Armorer's hands. Garth is again THROWN BACK BY SUCCESSIVE ROUNDS, and then to the floor. The Armorer reloads, begins firing again as Garth tries t get up, finally succeeds, assaults forward toward the Arm as he reloads yet another magazine, and begins firing aga throwing Garth back. Garth topples behind the table. The Armorer switches to an AK-47.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Switching to a larger round... These heavier rounds throw Garth back to the wall. MOST

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shouting over din) It's advisable that you seek cover when being fired upon. While armor-deflected rounds can't penetrate, the concussive force of the round... (changes magazine, starts firing) -.. can disorient and in some cases render the recipient unconscious. I am avoiding the Major's head area for demonstration purposes. An enemy won't be so lenient. The Armorer finishes his last magazine and puts the AK-47 down. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 26.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garth rises, shaken, and marches for the Armorer, who rai a hand, signalling 'Stop.'

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (big smile) Just kidding. Garth stops, trying to control his anger.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch, you didn't warn me!

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: Major, you have just taken eighty direct hits. Under normal circumstances, one would have been enough to kill you. How do you feel? Garth grabs the smaller man and nearly lifts him off his feet. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I feel... SWELL. Garth drops the Armorer and surges past as Reich and LaPi share a look of amusement.

dialogues.speaker: THE RECHARGER PACK
dialogues.text: in the Armorer's hands is tugged open, revealing slots th accept body armor batteries, and dials for adjusting the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: twists the pack for Garth to see.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: The pack has its own armor. Don't let it take direct hits if you want to continue supplying power to your body armor. The unit accommodates ten batteries at a time, and can recharge them from cold to hot in about an hour. You'll go in with ten batteries charged in here, plus the twenty on your belt. Got it? This time Garth sneers at him and yanks the pack out of h hands. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 27.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: How many recharges?

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: Thirty. Maybe less. Battery technology is freaky... but you can connect to one-ten and recharge the batteries directly from house current, presuming there is house current.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SELECTION TABLE
dialogues.text: stands before a number of rifles and pistols arrayed on t table. The Armorer, Reich and LaPiere watch from five pac away.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What do you got?

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Then what do you recommend?

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: Pulse rifle. He picks up the pulse rifle and throws it to Garth.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Has the punch of a fifty with almost no recoil. Uses the same batteries as the armor, fifty rounds of decreasing intensity. Has a tendency to start fires. That could be problematical...

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Choose another gun. Garth looks at him a moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I'll take it. What else?

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: I recommend an automatic pistol. Two, if you don't mind the weight. This Smith & (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 28.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ARMORER (cont'd) Wesson is pretty slick. It holds fifty rounds of five-point-five-six and spits them out at a rate of five hundred rounds a minute.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I'll take two. What else?

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: Grenade launcher —

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: I've got knives... survival... serrated edge... stiletto...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: The stiletto and the survival knife. What else?

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: I've got some cowboy junk... combat bow...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Too bulky.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: (continuous ) +.. miniature crossbow.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Let me see it. The Armorer removes a metal pen from his shirt pocket, presses a button. The shaft elongates to four times its original length, bow arms pop out at one end, a handle at other. He places it in Garth's hand.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: Carries five shafts inside the tube. No, wait, you twist the eraser... there. Garth twists the eraser and five tiny metal arrows slide his palm. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 29.

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You preload the weapon, collapse it, and keep it in your shirt pocket, or clip it anywhere... Garth mounts a metal arrow in the bow... looks up with an admiring smile... and TURNS AND AIMS SO FAST IT IS ONE CL MOTION. THE ARROW SHOOTS OUT... and PINS THE ARMORER'S SH TO THE WALL. An inch left, neck, not shirt. Garth walks to the Armorer, who is shaking with fear, and pulls the arrow out with his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Just kidding. How do you feel? Do you feel swell? (on Armorer's emphatic gesture) I thought you would.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOMATIC DEFENSE UNIT
dialogues.text: on a display table. It is a coffin-shaped box. The Armore activates a control panel that pops up, switches it on. A automated machine gun rises, its microservos 'whirring' a revolves left, then right.

dialogues.speaker: THE ARMORER, GARTH, REICH, LAPIERE
dialogues.text: observe the weapon. The Armorer is still shaken from Gart ‘joke. '

dialogues.speaker: ARMORER
dialogues.text: This is a fully automated night defense mechanism. Turn it on and it will shoot anything moving beyond a four foot perimeter. So you can catch some shut- eye.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: (snide grin) Hope you don't toss in your sleep. Garth depresses the ‘off' button and the machine gun rece inside its box with a SNAP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth, Reich and LaPiere on the passenger bench. Reich ha Garth a hand radio. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 30

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: (above din of helicopter) Take this. Radio signals are jammed inside the mansion, but you can use it once the power's down... Work your way to the central atrium, then downstairs to the computer, shut off the nuke. Then work your way to the roof and call us. We'll come in. Simple. Garth grins cynically at the word 'simple.' Beyond the chopper windows, the Los Angeles basin stretch like a vast archaeological dig, fires rising like pillars support the smoky sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper maneuvers carefully to avoid the top of the mansion. The structure is huge, a competitor of the Getty itself, three stories high and god knows how many stories below ground, its style inspired by Frank Lloyd Wright's Hollyhock House. The helicopter lands in the field outside the mansion grounds. Garth drops out with his equipment. The chopper rises and speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW GARTH
dialogues.text: as he trudges to the mansion's outer walls. They are low, knee-high so as not to block the view of the mansion. Gar stands before them for moments with nothing happening. He picks up a stone and tosses it over the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY DOGS
dialogues.text: appear from either side of the structure and run full-til toward Garth. They are mechanized animals that mimic the thing. Garth watches them approach, doesn't move, weapons still holstered or strung. The dogs stop at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Nice doggy... I'm outside the wall. See? The dogs bark menacingly. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 31.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garth removes one of the Smith & Wesson pistols from his belt, holds it casually to his side. The barking increases. Garth SHOOTS. ROUNDS SPIT OUT at a rate of five hundred a minute. THE FIRST DOG IMPLODES. The second shoulders to t wall itself, increases its barking.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can't attack anything outside the perimeter, can you? Ah, the wonderful world of insurance companies. Garth replaces the magazine. Aims it at the remaining dog Considers.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ciao, Fido. Fires. The dog staggers back beneath the CONCUSSIVE FORCE THE STREAM OF BULLETS, then EXPLODES. Everything is startlingly quiet. Garth replaces the magaz reholsters the gun, stares out at the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: THE VINCENT MANSION GROUNDS
dialogues.text: invites a stroll... a picnic... an afternoon in Elysium.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME GARTH
dialogues.text: as he thinks about this. Garth leaps the fence and enters the grounds. No dogs. No response. Nothing. Somehow, Garth was expecting more. He shrugs, moves for t house. Halfway across the grounds Garth freezes.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: slam down one by one— pomb! pomb! pomb! — seemingly appea in place, to cover the windows with reinforced steel plat  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 32.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME GARTH
dialogues.text: as he realizes his progression across the grounds trigger this defense. An instant later two more dogs spring from either side of building and run toward him. Garth drops to one knee, pulls the pulse rifle off his shoulder, brings it up to fire... A BULLET HITS DEAD CENTER and knocks Garth off his feet. BODY ARMOR FLASHES. A second round hits. A third.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOGS
dialogues.text: have Garth bracketed, firing from automatic rifles that h risen from slots located in their backs.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME GARTH
dialogues.text: as he stands and runs for the main entrance, the dogs following. Garth slides into a prone position at the main entrance a THE ROUNDS CONTINUE TO IMPACT.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH'S WRIST COUNTER
dialogues.text: shows the declining effectiveness of his body armor. 91.. 84... 80... 77... 69... (Ding! Ding! Ding! Ding!)

dialogues.speaker: RESUME GARTH
dialogues.text: as he brings the pulse rifle up, turns to face the incomi rounds, BODY BOUNCING WITH THEIR IMPACT, and fires. The first dog disappears in a flash. Garth turns, IMPACTS STILL MAKING HIS BODY QUAKE, and fir The second dog EXPLODES WITH A WHELP. Garth drops the pulse rifle and stands angrily.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (hurting) Damn! Damn it! Body armor hell! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 33.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He ejects the battery from the armor, slams a fresh batte into the slot. Then he drops his packs and shakes and twi his limbs to relieve the sting.

dialogues.speaker: A MOMENT LATER
dialogues.text: stands admiring the main entrance. It is a two-story bron double-door, with carved Roman figures presenting a battl tableau. Garth steps back onto the lawn, ten paces away, looks lef then right.

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDOWS
dialogues.text: steel plate have none of the elegance of this door, but a formidable nonetheless.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: paces back to the huge door, removes an explosive charge one of the packs, adheres it to the lock and steps away. A small EXPLOSION. The door swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth carries his equipment into the room. The door swings shut behind him. Garth drops his packs, tests the door with a shove. Locke

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Thought that was too easy. Garth turns to survey the room.

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTRANCE ROOM
dialogues.text: is a vast hall that recedes into the shadows. The lights not on. Doors line the walls to either side, each two-sto tall and each a different shade of green or red. A statue of the god Jupiter, four times human size, comma the near space.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 34.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: hefts his packs and marches to Jupiter, drops them at the god's feet. He turns to the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (calling out) Take a potshot at me here, Jupiter is gonna get a hotfoot! Nothing. No response.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (softly) You can come out now, Diana. I know you're here. Silence. Garth shrugs, turns to unload his packs.

dialogues.speaker: A ROBOT
dialogues.text: rolls past Garth, who pivots and pulls one of his pistols The robot is a jumble of appendages tipped with various devices. It proceeds to the door, which opens to receive A welding device begins to make repairs on the main lock.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: watches for a moment... returns the gun to its holster... removes a tin of food, pulls out a wafer and takes a bite opens the notebook computer.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: is cards being shuffled. The final card: The welder robot

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (SCENE)
dialogues.text: looks up from the screen at the still welding robot.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (reading) E-sixty-five-thirty... Repairbot... Secondary weapons platform... No shields, (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 35

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GARTH (cont'd) no body armor... Aggression quotient — zip. The robot finishes the repairs. The door closes. The robo rolls past Garth again. Garth continues to eat the wafer doesn't bother to draw a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks for the prompt service. See you soon. The robot lumbers into the shadows down the vast hall.

dialogues.speaker: A FLASHLIGHT BEAM
dialogues.text: searches the high reaches of the ceiling. It finds a television camera eye.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: keeps the flashlight aimed with one hand, brings a S&W pi up, aims, fires.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: A little to the left... (fires again) ++. once more, with feeling...

dialogues.speaker: THE TELEVISION EYE
dialogues.text: high above SHATTERS WITH THE BULLET IMPACT.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: returns the pistol to its holster.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Let's see you repair that. He moves down the hall, shining the flashlight high looki for more monitoring stations. He finds one just as the SO of a miniature helicopter whisks past overhead. Garth pivots and aims the light.

dialogues.speaker: A MINIATURE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: carrying a replacement for the destroyed minicam beneath moves for the destruction site in the corner of the ceili  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 36.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: scrambles back.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Shit. Spoke too soon. Aiming the light with one hand, the gun with the other, h follows the movement of the helicopter near the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: flips on its back, bringing the repair module into positi for placement. Garth's rounds begin to impact all around it... then a di hit. EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lowers the weapon and the light. He turns, quickly survey the dark ceiling down the hall, then moves. Garth returns to the second camera site... aims... fires. moves on. A third site, opposite wall. The same. A fourth site, same wall. He aims both light and weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as four laser beams shoot out from various locations and him squarely.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: is thrown ten feet back and to the ground. STEAM RISES FROM HIS BODY ARMOR. Garth's closed eyes twitch. Slowly he comes to. He glances at his body armor wrist read-out.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 37.

dialogues.speaker: WRIST READ-OUT
dialogues.text: Garth's body armor wrist read-out: 09.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: realizes that another blow like that will penetrate his b armor and kill him. Should he move? Carefully, Garth moves one arm back several inches, then other. A leg rises, seeks footing. He shoves himself a fo farther away from the weapons in the walls and ceiling. Again. Again. Slowly. Trying not to draw fire. Again. Garth freezes.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA LOGAN
dialogues.text: stands in Garth's path looking down at him. She is not qu real. She is not quite a ghost, either. She wears an outf military tunic and slacks — that, while very feminine, is also all business.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You are an intruder. Garth can't quite believe he's not alone. He raises a leg moves his shoulders, and shoves himself another foot away from the weapons... and into Diana, passing through her. looks for her source.

dialogues.speaker: THE IMAGE PROJECTOR
dialogues.text: is a shoebox with wheels, stopped nearby. A beam of light shoots out, PROJECTING Diana.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: pushes himself along the floor again. Diana's feet seem t grow out of his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Go away. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 38.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I have called the police and they are en route... but you haven't caused any real damage yet. Go now and we'll forget this illegal intrusion. Garth shoves himself along the floor again. He and Diana to share feet.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: There are no police.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Of course there are police.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Talk to them lately? This shuts her up. Garth flips over and begins to crawl.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You can get up. You're out of range.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Like I'm going to believe you. Diana BLINKS OUT OF EXISTENCE. The shoebox whisks away, engine WHINING. Garth continues to crawl... rises to his feet... runs.

dialogues.speaker: AT JUPITER
dialogues.text: leaps behind the statue for cover. Breathing hard, takes stock of himself. Replaces the body armor battery. (Chink hum!)

dialogues.speaker: BODY ARMOR READ-OUT
dialogues.text: goes from 09 to 100.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Pulls a nightscope from his pack, clicks it into place on of the pulse rifle, brings it to eye level, takes a look.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 39.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTSCOPE
dialogues.text: is no longer in darkness. It glows orange. The IMAGE ZOOMS: Closest sensor in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: The police have turned up Vincent Drive. There's still time to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks up from the scope. Diana stands near him, projected the shoebox.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I don't want you to get into trouble... Garth swings the rifle around, lazily aims it at the shoe

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know a way you can escape. If you'll just trust— Garth fires. The shoebox EXPLODES, its parts spinning awa Diana DISAPPEARS. Garth brings up the rifle scope.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTSCOPE
dialogues.text: painted orange. The flash of the first round bleeds out vision for a second. When it returns, Garth has moved the sight to the next sensor, and fires.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: takes out the final three sensors. Digs out a pair of nightgoggles.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Hate these goddamn things. Pulls them on. Stands.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 40

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTGOGGLES
dialogues.text: is bathed in a slightly different color.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: moves down the hall along one wall, looking up, pistol dr He passes where he was knocked unconscious by the laser beams.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTGOGGLES
dialogues.text: Laser weapons hang by wiring, destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: pulls off the nightgoggles, hangs them by the strap to th unused pistol on his belt, wipes sweat away from his brow He moves back toward his camp at Jupiter's feet.

dialogues.speaker: JUPITER
dialogues.text: drops the goggles back into the pack, sits on the pedesta Taking a swig of water from his canteen:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: So, Jupiter, you're a god. What are you going to do next? (god's voice) I'm going to Disneyland! Garth sees the control panel door imbedded in the pedesta

dialogues.speaker: GARTH'S FINGER
dialogues.text: taps the panel open. A switch. He presses it.

dialogues.speaker: THIRTY, EIGHT-YEAR-OLD KIDS
dialogues.text: materialize at Jupiter's feet, several occupying the same space as Garth. Garth stands, walks around the 3-D projection. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 41.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A BEAM OF LIGHT from behind Jupiter's head is the source the PROJECTION, unlike the earlier Diana, the PLAYBACK of recording. Diana greets the children. She wears a tunic similar to t previous one, slacks, hair tied back, business yes, but womanly, too.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Hello, boys and girls... My name is Diana Logan. An unseen teacher prompts:

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Kids — you know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHILDREN
dialogues.text: Hello, Ms. Logan!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'm the Chief of Security of this wonderful place... and I'm going to be your guide today. Can any of you tell me who Mr. Vincent is?

dialogues.speaker: THE CHILDREN
dialogues.text: Me! Me!... I know!... I raised my hand first! Diana picks a shy little girl who has raised her hand. Garth moves through the PROJECTIONS as if they're ghosts, he is.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Do you know?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Theodore Vincent is the richest man in the world.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yes, some people say that... It may even be true... But the Mr. Vincent I know loves art more than anything else in the world. He built this residence so that someday it can be converted into a museum.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: Just like the Getty! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 42.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garth stops finally before Diana and studies her. This PROJECTION is obviously a recording, and unaware of his presence.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (laughs) I'm not sure he would appreciate that... but you're right... someday this magnificent building will be like the Getty, a museum for everyone to visit. Today you're very lucky children, because I'm going to show you what most kids don't get a chance to see — the Vincent treasures. The children chortle their anticipation. The PROJECTION G DARK. Leaving Garth standing in shadows.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: So that's what you were like... in life. No one answers. Garth shrugs off the mood, moves.

dialogues.speaker: NOTEBOOK COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: The doors to either side of this hall lead to galleries, beyond, another hall.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: looks up.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Eenie-meenie-minie-moe...

dialogues.speaker: AT BRONZE DOUBLE DOORS
dialogues.text: drops his pack and rifle, removes an explosive and places charge against the door, retreats ten feet.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Garth opens the doors to the new gallery.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 43.

dialogues.speaker: THE GALLERY
dialogues.text: is half as long as the hall. Life-size statues line the corridor at ten-feet intervals. Garth stands at the threshold, pack, rifle, ready. Nothing moves in the darkness. Something in Garth's hands: The remains of the shoebox device. Garth tosses the twisted metal far into the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE OF GALLERY
dialogues.text: is broken by the rolling shoebox. DIANA AND HER THIRTY KIDS MATERIALIZE in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: This gallery is called 'The Greek Room' because the antiquities displayed here originated in classical times. Does anyone know what ‘classical’ means?

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN
dialogues.text: I do! I do!... No, me! Me!

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: watches the ghost show thirty yards distant.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (sotto) ‘Classic' means 50s rock'n'roll. (begins singing: ) One-two-three o'clock, four o'clock rock... five-six-seven o'clock, eight o'clock rock... (etc. ) Pulls the nightgoggles down over his eyes. Leans in to th farthest line of the threshold, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: -.. yes. ‘Classical’ means 'pre- Christian,' or before the rise of Christianity.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 44.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTGOGGLES
dialogues.text: Same TV sensors as before. Same laser weaponry.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: In this room, there are statues and other antiquities that were created by the Greek civilization...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: removes the goggles. Brings the rifle with nightscope up. FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: FAR CEILING
dialogues.text: EXPLODE in a hail of sparks.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: steps back quickly as THREE LASER BEAMS STRIKE the inside perimeter of the threshold.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ... Agamemnon, whose wife Helen was stolen by Paris, son of Priam, King of Troy, and so started the Trojan War... This piece was fished out of the Bay of Naples in 1887 and is believed to date from the early second century B.C. ... Who knows what 'B.C.' means? (etc. ) Realizing that the ceiling weapons aren't designed to fir outside the gallery, Garth steps forward to the threshold brings the rifle to his shoulder and FIRES THREE REPETITI

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (sotto - as he fires) B.C?... Before Cher?... Before Cher there was Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: FAR CEILING
dialogues.text: EXPLODE in sequence.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 45

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: lowers the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ... that's right, ‘Before Christ.’

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (sotto) No! Wait! I didn't say, ‘Final answer.'

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Although in recent years some people have begun using the term, ‘Before Common Era’ or B.C.E. in deference to other cultures or other religious beliefs. (etc. ) This leaves the two camera/laser rifles located in the ceiling directly above the threshold. Garth dares to lean out, look up. A LASER BEAM STRIKES, barely missing his head as he snaps back. Garth pulls the nightgoggles back over his eyes. Steeling himself, Garth leaps into the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: GALLERY
dialogues.text: leaps inside, rolling toward the nearest statue as LASER BEAMS TRACE HIS PATH. Garth pulls himself behind the silhouette of the statue a THE BEAMS CEASE.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: .--- believed to be a rendition of Paris, who was so captivated by the beauty of Helen that he absconded with her... Garth counts silently, then rolls out with a PISTOL AND F into one corner, then the other. The second round misses. LASER FIRE STRIKES his body armor.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 46. THE WRIST READ-OUT DROPS FROM 100 TO 61. Garth drops to the floor and FIRES again. The laser GOES DARK MID-FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: --. Hector, the greatest hero of Troy, who fought Achilles, whose mother made him almost invulnerable by dipping all but his heel in a magical stream... (etc. ) Garth tears the goggles off, sweating, breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Maybe that's why women think guys are heels. Garth replaces his body armor battery with one from the p

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: --. is Helen, as one ancient artist saw her...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Shut up! Goddamn it! The shout echoes through the marble hall.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: She's not very pretty...

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: And she's naked!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Well yes, beauty, it's said, is in the eye of the beholder... and in art, the human body is often depicted nude... Gulping water from his canteen:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Christ...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: .-. have no more questions, I'll take you to the next gallery, where we'll see... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 47.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DIANA AND THE CHILDREN DISAPPEAR just as a REPAIRBOT SHOO THROUGH THE IMAGE, whisking by to repair the door that Ga just blew. Garth turns and fires on instinct, sending the REPAIR DEV BURNING, SPARKING AND SPINNING OUT OF CONTROL.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: with the nightgoggles shoved high onto his forehead, walk down the gallery, carrying the pulse rifle lazily in one hand. The repairbot lies a jumble of twisted metal and smoking circuit boards. Helen stares down at him from her pedestal. Garth stops to appraise her.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: That kid doesn't know anything, Helen... You're a hotty. Helen's pose does not change, although the flashlight in Garth's hand shifts her shadows as he moves forward. Garth crosses the sealed beam that activated the film bef DIANA AND THE CHILDREN APPEAR.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: This gallery is called 'The Greek Room' because the antiquities displayed here originated in classical times. Does anyone know what ‘classical’ means?

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN
dialogues.text: I do! I do!... No, me! Me!

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Oh, christ, not again...

dialogues.speaker: ONE 3-D IMAGE OF DIANA STEPS THROUGH A SECOND 3-D IMAGE,
dialogues.text: followed by a new shoebox projection device.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: The controller is located in that panel. You can turn the tour off. Garth is conflicted. Could the panel be boobytrapped? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 48.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DIANA (cont'd) Well, I can't operate it. That's for sure. Garth steps to the wall, opens the panel, presses the 'st button.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR DIANA
dialogues.text: -.. yes. ‘Classical’ means 'pre- Christian,' or before the rise of—

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS.
dialogues.text: Garth pivots and marches back to his ‘camp.' Diana, and her shoebox, follow.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I'm alive. You're dead. That's all either of us needs to know.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I know what I am.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You're a program, a doppelganger... You're not real anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I am a disembodied human being. Vincent Enterprises developed a way to move my consciousness into this computer... all of it... me.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Diana has no answer for this.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: That should be obvious.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Why haven't the police come? Why don't they answer? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 49.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I told you — there are no police.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: What's happened to the world?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: The same as you... Worse. Garth begins to gather up his equipment and supplies.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: If you go any further, you'll wish the police came and stopped you.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: This facility is defended by a non- commercial upgrade of a Vincent Embassy Protection System — VEPS. In case you're too ignorant to know what that means... fully lethal defense systems. Killing machines, Mr. ... Garth brings the pulse rifle up. The shoebox retreats into the darkness. Diana BEGINS TO FADE, lose resolution, as the device retreats.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please stop destroying my — Garth fires.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: finishes gathering his supplies, carts everything down th gallery. As he crosses the sealed beam mid-gallery:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Please stop destroying my mobile projectors. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 50.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're inoffensive. They carry no weapons. Garth looks at her for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You have a point. Get to it.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: My point is that I don't want you to die.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You care about what happens to me?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Of course I do...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: And your boss, Vincent... he cared when he installed all these killing machines to protect his expensive trinkets?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: He never expected to need them! He installed them as a deterrent.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: So he never expected anyone to get killed?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Or hurt someone, even?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Then I should be dodging blanks now... You were Vincent's Chief of Security even before you died, right?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yes. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 51.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You don't strike me as the kind of person who winds up being Chief of Security.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It's a little late in my career to start quibbling over qualifications, don't you think?... But I have a masters degree in police science.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You and Vincent were friends, correct?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You're trying to insinuate something.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: And you're a good looking woman... or were.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (cynical grin) You bastard!

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Not a new observation... So you were lovers for awhile... then he rewarded you.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I hope your death is quick and painless. DIANA DISAPPEARS . Garth grins.

dialogues.speaker: THE GALLERY DOORS
dialogues.text: at the end of the hall slam open and a dozen flying mini- helicopters bank through.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: yanks the nightgoggles down, brings the rifle up.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTGOGGLES
dialogues.text: carry fully functional weaponry from their undercarriages  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARTS FIRING even as he leaps toward the statue of Helen PULSE BEAMS BEGIN FLASHING all around him.

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPERS BEGIN FALLING, SPIRALING, EXPLODING AS THEY ARE
dialogues.text: Garth hugs the base of the statue, believing that its presence will protect him. Until a pulse beam from a helicopter SLICES THE STATUE IN TWO. Garth is without cover as the statue disintegrates above Garth's weapon is on full automatic: Boom-boom-boom-boom.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTGOGGLES
dialogues.text: continue to swoop down, firing pulse beams. There are sev left.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: checks his wrist read-out: 04. Garth slams another battery into his body armor. A PULSE ROUND SLICES THROUGH HIS ARM before the power jer on. He grimaces in pain. Garth's rifle is empty. The read-out, in red: 0. Garth tosses the rifle and pulls both S&W autopistols. He swings the fully automatic pistols together, creating minigun, AND FIRES. The remaining HELICOPTERS EXPLODE within the sweep of bullets. Silence. Garth shakes marble dust from his clothing, kicks chunks Helen away. Part of her face lands on his shoulder. On hi look:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Must be a fake.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: staggers out from the destroyed statue of Helen, retrieve the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Now that wasn't so bad, was it? Takes stock. His left arm is bleeding. Clothes ripped. Hungry. Tired. Thirsty. Licking his dry lips, he turns to retrieve his canteen — WHEN A STREAM OF BULLETS HITS HIM, slip-sliding his body uncontrollably across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE TANK
dialogues.text: is little more than treads with a machine gun mounted on now wheeling through the far open doors.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: slides behind the statue of Achilles. It must be real. Th bullets stop. Garth pulls himself from a stupor, takes stock. Arm still bleeding. Clothes still torn. Fingers move. Fee too. Wrist read-out: 03. Another battery shot. Garth reaches to pull a fresh battery from his belt, expo an arm WHERE BULLETS RIDDLE THE WALL AN INCH TO THE RIGHT Carefully now, he replaces the body armor battery. The movement causes the machine gun to track him. Up-down left-right, servos whining. Only the statue keeps the uni from firing.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S SHOEBOX
dialogues.text: rolls up behind the tank, halts as if concerned about bei shot by Garth, then advances.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 54.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA MATERIALIZES
dialogues.text: near Garth.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You're hurt.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Go away.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You should apply direct pressure to that.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I said... GO AWAY!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I know who you are. Garth tries to stop the flow of blood by applying direct pressure. He winces.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (preoccupied) You do?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You're Major John Garth, United States Army Rangers. You were born in Pasadena, California, in March —

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: So you found my goddamn records!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Why is an honorable man like you breaking into a private residence?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: There are no more honorable human beings — just hungry ones.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Is that all? You're hungry? I can tell you where there's food. Tons of it.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Tons of it?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Earthquake supplies. Wafers; cakes; MREs — meals-ready-to-eat; bread; water; (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 55.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DIANA (cont'd) coffee — instant; coffee — drip; you name it. Garth moves slowly, watching the weapon track him.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: And you're going to show me how to get at it... without getting my dick shot off. Diana says nothing for a long moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: If you drop your weapons, VEPS won't take action against you.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You mean... if I surrender, I can walk around here without being shot at?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No... You'll be taken into custody, held for —

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: The police.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: That is the procedure.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: There is no police.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: So you say. Garth shifts. The machine gun follows him, servos whining The statue continues to provide cover.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Why don't you just... turn the machines off?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Aren't you the Chief of Security? Aren't you the soul of the machine? Why can't you just stop shooting at me?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It doesn't work like that. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 56.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Your mind controls everything, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yes, but... the defensive equipment is linked to my autonomic nervous system. I can no more stop the defensive units than I can stop breathing.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You aren't breathing. You're a goddamn ghost. Diana thinks about that for a second. Yes, that's exactly what she is.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: My mind works the same way as when... I was alive. That's why Mr. Vincent gave me this opportunity, to remain... alive... inside EnCrypt.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Where is Vincent, by the way? Diana turns away, considering the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: throws the spent battery. The tank gun tracks the flight of the battery into the darkness. Garth leaps out from behind the statue and lands on the t The tank gun barrel tries to find Garth, who stands above beyond its tracking range. Garth pulls a survival knife, begins to pry open the tank metal access plate. The tank's treads SQUEAL as it accelerates toward the nea unadorned wall. Garth hangs on, prying with the knife. The tank slams into the wall, almost throws Garth, backs slams into the wall again. Garth clings to the machine gun barrel, yanks off the acc plate, stabs the knife deep into a row of circuit boards. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 57.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The tank SPITS SMOKE AND SPARKS, DIES. Garth removes the ammo feeder, tosses it into the darknes Sucking for wind, sweat cascading from his skin, Garth ey Diana warily as she slowly walks to the tank.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA AND GARTH
dialogues.text: study one another for a long moment before:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: If you can't shut the damn things off... maybe you can warn me.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Warn you?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
