dialogues.text: You know where everything is, don't you? You know which machines are operational, which ones are in stand-by mode, which ones—

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Really, this whole question would be a moot point... if you just surrendered.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: So you can hold me for the police?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Certainly. You have less to fear from them... (looking back toward the darkness) -.. than me.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: That might be a long wait.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: So you say.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You might save my life... if you briefed me on what to expect. Diana considers that possibility for a moment. Then: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 58.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: This is not the pattern of a burglar. A burglar would have taken something and gone. Garth merely looks at her image as it moves.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If there really is no police, as you say... then you've come to cut the power and take everything. That... (surveys him) .-. is why I won't help you.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: If I cut the power, what becomes of you?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I will become what you say I already am.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Death as a blackout. I've feared worse things.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Go now. Take whatever you find back there. If you go forward, you won't survive. Garth retrieves his rifle, slides a fresh battery into it HUMS.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've heard that before, too. Diana considers this exchange a moment, then DISAPPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S SHOEBOX
dialogues.text: whines away into the darkness, passing through the opened double doors at the end of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: gathers up the rest of his equipment, drinks from the canteen, limps back to the pack.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 59.

dialogues.speaker: AEROSOL SPRAY SKIN
dialogues.text: flows onto Garth's wound, sealing everything. Garth tosse the can away, rips open a low-tech field bandage, gently places it on the wound in his arm.

dialogues.speaker: IN A CORNER OF THE GALLERY
dialogues.text: crumples against the wall. Depleted, he must rest. An afterthought, he pulls the Automatic Defense Unit from pack, opens the panel, flicks it on.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUN
dialogues.text: rises from its coffin-shaped container and enters 'ready' mode, barrel poised to fire at any target that presents itself.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: makes sure that he's within the four-foot fire-free zone around the gun, then removes the gunbelt and makes himsel comfortable. He searches the pack for fast energy food. T bite-sized snacks fall through his fingers like coins.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (reading labels) Chicken gumbo... (tosses it)... Steak Tartar with red dye number seven... (tosses it)... allergic to red dye number seven... Brandy Mousse... (unwrapping the plastic) Combat is getting elegant. (chews - reacts) Think ya got enough sugar in there, Butch?

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: lies sleeping, head propped against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: THE HALLS OF THE RESIDENCE
dialogues.text: are long and dark. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 60

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Debris of combat gives way to shining floors and pools of purple nebulae.

dialogues.speaker: FLOAT THROUGH THE CORRIDORS
dialogues.text: past Garth sleeping on the floor... into the gallery of paintings... through opening doors into the gallery of jewels... through more doors into other realms of histori order... until a woman waits at the end of the gallery. ELAINE is beautiful, with long, flowing red hair and skin color of porcelain. Her green-green eyes glow like emeral her red lips not tainted by makeup but truly red, teeth a perfect as creation before the end of Eden.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: stands before her. He is not wearing torn combat clothes, a suit styled by future hands.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: John... how I've wanted to hold you again.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Elaine, let me take you home.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (shaking her head 'no') I have a different home now... Do you know what became of me? This is a question he would rather not contemplate.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I searched for you, Elaine, I did!

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: There was no food, Garth. There was nothing. Our son was hungry. I kept waiting for you to come, but... you didn't. So I went out looking for food... The market was empty. There were men there, Garth. They raped me. Then they butchered me and took my flesh to their homes and fed their families with me. This last thing I didn't mind. I saved a child's life. At least, my body did. Garth can take this story no more. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 61.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Elaine! God, no! The pain is more than he can bare. Garth drops to his kne tears and snot and saliva spewing from him as he bellows pain.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (reaching to touch, but unable) Don't mourn me, John. What's done is done. But you're still alive.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I'm not alive, Elaine. None of us is alive anymore!

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Yes you are. You owe it to those of us who are dead — stay alive, John!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth snaps awake beside the wall. Nothing has changed fr when he went to sleep. Except a haunting SOUND drifting f a far place. Garth turns off the Automatic Defense Unit, grabs his rifle, moves for the far double doors.

dialogues.speaker: GALLERY OF PAINTINGS
dialogues.text: stops at the threshold, snaps the nightgoggles down, look in.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTGOGGLES
dialogues.text: No sensors. No weaponry in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: pushes the goggles up, considers. The haunting SOUND is closer, but still not close. Garth leaps into a run down the gallery toward the noise. As he passes a closed beam mid-gallery, DIANA AND HER THI CHILDREN APPEAR as 3-D projections. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 62.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: This, boys and girls, is the Gallery of Landscapes... (etc. )

dialogues.speaker: THE GALLERY OF PORTRAITS
dialogues.text: stops at its threshold, flips the nightgoggles down, look

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTGOGGLES
dialogues.text: Again no sensors, or weapons.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: advances into the hall. The SOUND is closer now, a haunti otherworldly wail. Gath brings the pulse rifle up, checks the charge (100 in green), advances. The SOUND grows louder, louder yet, increasing in volume emotion, a noise so terrifying that its existence seems impossible.

dialogues.speaker: A GHOST
dialogues.text: floats through the far doorway and turns, heading toward Garth. It is the corpse of a man, arms and legs dangling, eyes glowing red, the wordless wail rising from its throa

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: grins.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Ah, a ghost... Garth brings the pulse rifle up, takes his time aiming. H FIRES. The ghost TWISTS IN THE HOLD OF SUCCESSIVE ROUNDS, writhi and bellowing its unearthly, artificial SOUND until its

dialogues.speaker: DISGUISE AS A GHOST LOSES DEFINITION AND THE MACHINE BEHI
dialogues.text: IT CAN BE PERCEIVED. It begins to falter.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 63.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: is so preoccupied with the ghost that he doesn't see the sized robot roll toward him from behind. The robot grabs with huge pincer-arms, causing Garth to drop the pulse ri The robot's momentum carries them past the sealed beam wh ACTIVATES YET ANOTHER DIANA 3-D projection.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Okay guys, this is the fun gallery, at least for me... These are all portraits of real people from history... (etc. ) Garth writhes in the hands of the robot, its STEEL FINGER CLOSING ON HIS BODY ARMOR, WHICH SPARKS WITH RESISTANCE. Garth's single free hand slams against the robot's metal skin, without effect. Garth pulls the survival knife, rams it into a crevice in robot body, jerks it, snapping off the tip of the blade. The robot turns with Garth's splayed body, moving for som dark destination. A last ditch effort, Garth slams the broken blade into on the paintings as they pass. The blade digs deep into the canvas and is dragged an inch before the robot halts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in crystal understanding: If the robot continues, Garth w destroy the painting. Moments pass as Garth's lungs suck air and sweat cascades from his brow. The blade moves a millimeter in the canvas flesh, a woman bosom. The robot's eyes move to the painting, back to Garth. One robot hand relaxes. On Garth's movement, the other. Garth slowly pulls himself from the robot's grasp, steps down. While the steel hands are empty, GUN BARRELS LOCATED IN T ROBOT'S CHEST follow Garth's every movement. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 64.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Moments pass. Garth reaches for the fallen rifle. The robot watches. Garth's fingers almost make contact with the weapon. Will have to release the knife in order to retrieve the rifle? Garth gives up, withdraws his hand... and extends a leg, makes contact with the rifle. The robot whirls and accelerates down the gallery, its tr squealing in retreat. Garth releases the blade and retrieves the rifle, brings up to shoot. The first round hits the retreating robot as IT WHISKS THROUGH THE 3-D IMAGE OF DIANA AND HER CHILDREN like an aircraft through clouds. Garth FIRES AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN... PULSE BOLTS STRIKE the robot repeatedly. It explodes in f and wanders off track, finally stopping altogether. An unearthly SOUND makes Garth spin around.

dialogues.speaker: MORE GHOSTS
dialogues.text: float across the threshold of the far gallery, each diffe in its horrific representation — a child, a crone, a woma aman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: begins firing immediately. So do the ghosts — PULSE BOLTS THAT STRIKE GARTH'S ARMOR FLASH. The FIRST GHOST IS DESTROYED, the child. The SECOND, the crone. The THIRD, closing with Garth, DIES IN AN EXPLOSION of metallic flesh. But by the time he turns the pulse rifle on the fourth, t woman, the rifle is depleted. Garth retreats.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they move through the Gallery of Landscapes to the Gal of Roman Statues, Garth MERE FEET AHEAD OF THE SCREAMING

dialogues.speaker: BANSHEE, SOMETIMES DODGING, AND SOMETIMES NOT DODGING THE
dialogues.text: PULSE BOLTS the machine spits at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dives for his waiting S&W pistols as the GHOST CONTINUES FIRE PULSE ROUNDS at him. Garth brings the PISTOLS UP AND STARTS FIRING. The ghost ABSORBS THE ROUNDS AGAINST ITS METAL SKIN, its ‘ghost' persona fading to reveal the stainless steel mons beneath. Both weapons are emptied of bullets. The ghost floats menacingly before Garth for seconds, THE DROPS LIKE SCRAP TO THE FLOOR. Garth sags to his knees, finally begins reloading the weapons.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: No, don't, silly! No... No!

dialogues.speaker: 3-D ELAINE,
dialogues.text: wearing jean cutoffs and a pull-over, STRUGGLES WITH AN

dialogues.speaker: UNSEEN PERSON WHERE DIANA'S 3-D PROJECTION TOURED WITH
dialogues.text: CHILDREN MINUTES AGO. This is not the idealized Elaine of Garth's dream, but the real woman, capable of soil, sweat anger and tears.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Don't you dare!... You would not dare!... Don't you do it! Garth is too surprised to realize that this is a 3-D PROJECTION. He twists, moves toward her.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Elly? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 66.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A garden hose APPEARS IN THE FILM PROJECTION... then a younger Garth himself, who sprays Elaine. They are both laughing.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: Damn you, John Garth! A LITTLE BOY RUNS UP with a bucket of water and splashes mother with it.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no! You! I'm going to get you! Elaine chases her son farther into the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S SHOEBOX AND DIANA
dialogues.text: EMERGE THROUGH THE 3-D PROJECTION of Elaine and her famil

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: The National Security computer in Arlington, Virginia, is still up... Mr. Vincent has a key... The satellite communication system is still working. Garth cares about none of this. Seeing Elaine again is fa more important than anything Diana could say.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: During your last security clearance review... they placed you under surveillance... shot some film of your family. The 3-D film of Garth's backyard is REPLACED BY A TREE-LI WALK. The boy runs ahead as Elaine and Garth stroll, hand hand.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You two look... wonderful... together. Younger Garth and Elaine stop walking and steal a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened? The images of Elaine and his son draw Garth's flesh forwa where he topples to his knees beside them. Tears well in eyes. Finally: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 67.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: When the breakdown occurred... we were visiting Elaine's mother in Santa Monica. My father is dying of cancer. He lived in Burbank. I went to get him. There were riots, people killing each other, fires... I was gone days. When I finally got back... there was no one there.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You don't know what happened to your wife and child?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: No. The 3-D FILM ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that all there is?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Play it again!... PLAY IT AGAIN!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No... unless you stop what you're doing and — WHAM! Garth FIRES AT DIANA'S SHOEBOX sending the device flying in parts. DIANA DEMATERIALIZES.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Bitch! Garth sits on his knees for moments, sweat and tears commingling, breathing hard, trying to fathom what has be of everything and everyone he loved. DIANA REAPPEARS, projected by the tour lenses that previo showed Elaine and Garth's son.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now you know.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I was able to link with the national weather satellites through the Arlington computer... Yes, now I know. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 68.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Lower your security systems. Let Reich steal all your trinkets. I'll take the food, for the people... then you can go back to what you —

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Because I can't. I told you. The security devices are controlled through my autonomic nervous system. They are as automatic as breathing.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Then show me how to defeat them.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Because I'm not here to be your doormat.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: That earthquake food... it could feed a lot of people, save a lot of lives.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: So you say...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: So I say? SO I SAY?! People are eating each other out there! Diana is stunned by this revelation, made mute by it.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When was the last time you were hungry? Diana can't answer that. So long ago, it seems forever...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to take this place, like any military objective — one obstacle at a time... then I'm going to bring my people up here and we're going to live off those (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 69.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: earthquake supplies until... (dreaming of it, thinking of it) ++. until...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Until what?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Until I can think of something! We're not going to die, not all of us! We're not going to die! But he is speaking to darkness. DIANA HAS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lies in piles. He moves to retrieve it. Slams a new battery into the pulse rifle. Returns the pistol belt to his waist; slides the pistols holsters. Shoves the Automatic Defense System into the pack. Hefts everything, moves for the door.

dialogues.speaker: GALLERY OF LANDSCAPES
dialogues.text: trudges through, makes an immediate right. DIANA APPEARS BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: John Garth... why are you going that way?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Because all of the doors are unlocked... (gestures toward Diana) -.. that way.

dialogues.speaker: FAR GALLERY DOUBLE DOORS
dialogues.text: drops his pack, removes an explosive, places it at lock- level, stands back. The EXPLOSION trips the lock. The door swings open. Garth pulls the nightgoggles down, steps to the threshold  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 70

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTGOGGLES
dialogues.text: is unlike the other galleries. The statues glow. They are lifelike, carved by laser light, an intermingling of photography and sculpting, here magnified a thousand time the goggle's infrared.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: quickly shoves the nightgoggles from his eyes and rubs th DIANA MATERIALIZES before him, projected by a new shoebox

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: This is the Gallery of Laser Carvings. Everything in here is very fragile. If a bullet were to hit a carving and cause a short...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I sometimes feel the same way when a bullet whizzes past my head. Garth pushes through her into the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: GALLERY OF LIGHT CARVINGS
dialogues.text: quickly checks the ceilings for sensors or laser rifles. None. Garth grabs his equipment, begins moving forward.

dialogues.speaker: THE STATUES
dialogues.text: are 3-D projections of light carved by an artist to repre life and projected up from a base. Think Kodachrome. Some the statues are modern and geometric. Others are almost indistinguishable from life — a fawn, a waterfall, a sold in combat, lovers holding hands, others.

dialogues.speaker: A STATUE OF A NUDE WOMAN
dialogues.text: catches Garth's attention. He moves for the exhibit. The statue is twice life size. She is gathering flowers t her breast, a garland of flowers in her hair. Her express is one of rapt beauty, a representation of a woman at pea in a peaceful world. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 71.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It is Diana.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA AND GARTH
dialogues.text: look up at the light carving.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (unconvincing) I'm not ashamed of it. Garth drops his packs, circles the statue, saying nothing

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was a graduate student at UCLA... Mr. Vincent was one of the pioneers of laser carving.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You can stop calling him 'Mr.' now.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (an outburst) I'll call him any damn thing I want!... (controlling herself) ... He pursued me to model for him. Finally, I relented.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Was he that good... or were you that good? Diana looks away angrily. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Mr. Vincent's interest in me... exceeded the professional. He was in love with me. I never returned the affection.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You're lying.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: He bought you. He bought you with a job and he bought you with a laser statue. You want me to believe he didn't buy the rest of you too?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 72.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Vincent's not the kind of guy who doesn't get what he wants... unless...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Unless what? Garth considers not going on. But:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: When you were diagnosed as terminal, did you get a second opinion?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Of course I got a second opinion!

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Not one of Vincent's doctors?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No! What are you implying?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: He won you after all, didn't he? I mean, he got to keep you, young and beautiful, in his one-of-a-kind supercomputer... never to grow old... never to die... immortal and his, forever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana charges Garth. Just as HER 3-D HAND WOULD MAKE CONT with his face, SHE DISAPPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEXT GALLERY DOORS
dialogues.text: are also locked. Garth places the explosive, steps aside, the lock EXPLODES. Garth flips the nightgoggles down, glances in.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTGOGGLES
dialogues.text: is unadorned and relatively narrow, a real passageway. No sensors in the ceilings, no weapons that can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: hefts his equipment and enters the hallway.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 73.

dialogues.speaker: A FLASHLIGHT BEAM
dialogues.text: slices the darkness. More doors, more hallway. The flashlight swung in the opposite direction reveals shining metal doors: An elevator.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: moves down the hall toward the elevator, flashlight beam leading the way. He drops the pack, surveys the elevator controls.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR CONTROLS
dialogues.text: require both a key and a key card.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: drops the pack, removes the computer, runs a line from a port to a card, inserts it into the card slot adjacent to elevator. The computer begins running numbers through the card key. Garth finds a small case in the pack, opens it: Burglary tools. Garth begins to pick the standard lock.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: So you're a common burglar after all?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (working) Uncommon. For the CIA.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Fair play's poster children.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I'd argue the point... but it doesn't really matter anymore, now does it? Diana allows the vitriol to recede. Then: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 74.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: John, I don't want you to do this.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: John, is it? I hadn't realized we'd become so chummy.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (wryly) Well, you've seen me naked. I thought that would count for something.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Get on with it.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: If you go downstairs... I can't protect you. Garth turns, gives her his full attention.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Protect me?!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You don't really think you've defeated all of our security systems by yourself, do you? What if I had sent them all at once?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No. It's not... John, listen to me — downstairs is different. Mr. Vincent's residence is there, the computer room, the weapons storage bays... There's a stand-alone system down there, fully automated, a terrible killing machine that —

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (returning to work) Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It's called The Rook. It was designed to replace soldiers on the battlefield. It's dormant now, in a state of suspension, but as soon as your heat signature is read on the bottom floor, The Rook will activate and it will kill you. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 75

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garth searches her eyes for any signs of deception, then realizes that he is looking at a machine projection. He shrugs and returns to jimmying the lock. The elevator door slides open. Garth steps back. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You're lying... First, your defense mechanisms were designed to deal with terrorists — plural — more than one. They're set to activate individually, as needed. That's why you didn't send them all at once... Second, you'd say anything — do anything — to keep me from going down there. Am I right? Garth gathers his equipment, turns away from the elevator

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: That elevator opened too easily... and you control it.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIDDEN DOOR
dialogues.text: is a panel in the wall. Garth finds it, presses it. It op A stairwell leading down. Garth flips the nightgoggles down, takes a look:

dialogues.speaker: THE STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: hides no weapons.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: hefts his equipment, enters.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: descends the steps quickly, flashlight beam leading the w At the landing, Garth tries the door. Locked. He'll have blow it.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 76.

dialogues.speaker: THE LOCK IGNITES
dialogues.text: and the door swings ajar.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: swings the door open with the barrel of his pulse rifle, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: THE VINCENT RESIDENCE
dialogues.text: is a cavernous room, a vast "pleasure dome" to compare wi Kublai Khan's. Laser statuary, nudes mostly, illuminate t shadows, a glowing Christmas tree effect. Fountains and p divide the real estate, a waterfall across the room defin it. There are park benches, grassy knolls, trees hanging with weighted boughs, jutting boulders, and room enough t live forever unencumbered by petty problems.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S SHOEBOX
dialogues.text: rolls to the open door. Diana's IMAGE PROJECTS out. Garth remains across the threshold.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Don't do this. The moment you enter, The Rook will be activated. Garth snorts with disbelief and enters. Dazzling lights flash on the moment he crosses the thresh

dialogues.speaker: THE VINCENT ARMORY
dialogues.text: a humanoid creature with steel skin lies immersed in a wa tableau, art and war meeting in bas relief. Its eyes open, red pupils scanning.

dialogues.speaker: THE VINCENT RESIDENCE
dialogues.text: drops his packs, lowers the rifle to the floor, dazzled b the room. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 77.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Vincent certainly knew how to live, didn't he? Diana says nothing, but her image follows him.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where'd he sleep? Diana gestures: Over there.

dialogues.speaker: THE VINCENT BEDROOM
dialogues.text: is not delineated by walls. A huge bed seems to grow out giant oak, its mattress almost like a meadow of green. Overhead, man-made stars twinkle even in room light. Garth wanders up a lane toward it, eyes taking in everyth

dialogues.speaker: THE VINCENT ARMORY
dialogues.text: moves minutely as below it a computer screen flashes: ROO INITIATING PROTOCOL - INTRUDER ALERT.

dialogues.speaker: THE VINCENT BEDROOM
dialogues.text: touches the oak bed. It feels like real wood, with no rou edges. Diana's shoebox projector follows, as does she.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: When you have this kind of money... this kind of power... I guess you can have anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Mr. Vincent was known for his imagination. A quarter-sized statue of a nude man and woman in embrace stands near the bed. Garth touches it and the two come to life and begin to make love.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You didn't pose for this one too? Coital cries erupt from them. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 78.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Touch it again. Please. Taking a close look at the woman's body.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: She looks a little like you... here and there.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Touch it again! Please! Garth touches the light statue and it returns to its point and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (gesturing other statuary) Who were all these people?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Mr. Vincent had many lovers.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: The man in the sculpture... that was Vincent?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No... maybe... I don't know! Please leave here! Now! I'1l do what I can to stop anything from happening to you, but you've got to get out of here now.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: For a woman who's spent the last twenty years inhabiting this place, you don't seem to know a lot about it.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I don't spend that much time in the residence.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (turning away) Privacy. A matter of privacy.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Yours... or Vincent's? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 79.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: BOTH! You've got to go! Garth merely looks at her. DIANA DISAPPEARS .

dialogues.speaker: THE VINCENT ARMORY
dialogues.text: MATERIALIZES beside the Rook. Mist flows from around the creature, which was in cryogenic stasis. Its body tempera is rising.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: EnCrypt, this is Diana One Seven One Six Theta Theta Six. Rook activation override. Cease activation immediately.

dialogues.speaker: ENCRYPT VOICE
dialogues.text: You are not authorized...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Emergency override! Cancel activation now!

dialogues.speaker: ENCRYPT VOICE
dialogues.text: You are not authorized.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT'S RESIDENCE
dialogues.text: has reclined on a knoll, drinking and eating. DIANA MATERIALIZES beside him.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: The Rook is activated! It's coming! Garth observes her coolly for a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: If you're so concerned about my welfare, then tell me how to protect myself against this machine.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I can't! I can just warn you to go! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 80

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Why should you care so much about me?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You're a human being, aren't you? You're alive. You can't appreciate life until you've lost it. The admission impacts Garth. He sits up.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: If you can't tell me how to defeat this thing, then tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: The Rook is a fully autonomous combat operative. Its body armor is five times more effective than the obsolete armor you wear. This model has been programmed to kill with its hands, to protect property. It will tear your head from your body.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What are its weaknesses?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It has no weaknesses! A BOOM SOUNDS distantly.

dialogues.speaker: A HALLWAY
dialogues.text: slams through a set of doors moving fast.

dialogues.speaker: RESIDENCE
dialogues.text: stands, retrieves his rifle, the pack.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: is running now, inexorable, unstoppable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves quickly to within ten feet of the entrance to the stairwell. The shoebox and Diana follow. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 81.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garth retrieves several bricks of C-4 from the pack, toss the pack through the door, begins kneading the plastique together.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Run now! Do it! Leave! Garth finishes kneading the C-4 into a glob the size of a baseball, tucks it away in a pocket, brings the rifle up. A BOOM SOUNDS, closer. The Rook enters the residence at full run, already target against Garth. Garth brings the rifle within his sights and BEGINS FIRIN full automatic. Boom-boom-boom-boom! The pulse BOLTS STRIKE THE ROOK with effect. The Rook leaps obstacles and continues forward with inexorable power. Garth's pulse rifle empties. The Rook hits Garth at full tilt, slaps the rifle away, shoves him back, fingers reaching for Garth's throat. Garth resists the creature's hands. His BODY ARMOR SPARKS it cycles toward depletion. Momentum carries Garth through the doorway and into the stairwell. The Rook pushes Garth into the wall, fingers encircling h neck, ARMOR SPARKING. Garth struggles to bring his hand containing the C-4 up. plastique falls. The compressive force of the Rook's hands begin to strang Garth through the armor. Garth struggles, reaching for the C-4 on the ground. It's inches away. The Rook's red eyes bore into Garth, programed hatred. Garth begins to gag. The shoebox scoots into the stairwell. DIANA PROJECTS. Sh sees Garth's fingers reaching for the plastique. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 82.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Diana's eyes lock with Garth's. An empathy passes between them impossible for the Rook to understand. The shoebox accelerates into the C-4, sending it rolling Garth's hand. Garth slaps the C-4 onto the Rook's back. His other hand reaches for a battery in his beltpack. Garth's BODY ARMOR WRIST READ-OUT: 33... 26... 19... 15.. ll... Garth's fingers pull a battery from the beltpack. The Rook's red eyes bore in. Garth slaps the battery into the C-4. A LIGHT WRENCHING EXPLOSION.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: seems to kneel beside Garth. Garth pulls himself up to his elbows, checks his body arm INSERT - BODY ARMOR WRIST READ-OUT: 00.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: retrieves a battery from his belt, renews the body armor HUMMM — tries to stand, slips, finally reaches his feet.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Where is it? Diana gestures toward the end of the stairwell. Garth staggers several steps in that direction, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pushes debris from his body and sits up. Garth draws the two Smith and Wessons. By the time HE'S FIRING the Rook is moving on him. Garth retreats up the steps. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 83.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Its body armor blown, the Rook's chest RECEIVES THE BULLE ROUNDS like darts through Playdough. Garth EMPTIES THE PISTOLS, has no time to reload. The Rook grabs Garth's ankles and crawls up his fallen bo Garth plunges his damaged survival knife deep into the Ro bullet-pocked chest. No effect. The Rook's hands close around Garth's neck. Garth slams the knife repeatedly into the machine's body. Nothing. Beneath the Rook's flesh bio-mechanical devices ooze and revolve, levers pushing limbs. Garth's fingers reach for the railing, something to push against, to rise. No. The Rook's fingers close about Garth's neck. Garth has lost control of the knife, which sticks from th Rook's chest, its metal blade fostering sparks inside the machine. Garth grabs the knife handle, pulls, loses it, pulls agai again, finally dislodging the knife. The Rook squeezes Garth's neck, twisting, trying to wrenc his head from his body. Garth gags. Garth's body armor wrist gauge reads 23... 17... 14... 09 Garth raises the knife and plunges it deep into the Rook' head. The Rook's eyes go wide, then fail. The Rook falls from Garth's body, tumbles down the steps, bursts into flames.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: gasps for air, sucking oxygen into his lungs like water through a busted dam. After several long moments he stagg to his feet and descends the stairs, stepping carefully around the Rook's burning torso. Diana waits at the foot of the steps. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 84.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Are there any more where he came from? Diana looks at the carnage a moment before:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: None that are on line.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Then I've defeated every security device?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: In the residence, there was only this one... Garth steps past her.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: are advancing from debris hole to debris hole, weapons readied, some FIRING, as EXPLOSIONS pound the earth aroun them.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE RAMPARTS
dialogues.text: among others are returning fire. Clearly, they are outgun

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: sits tied down against the wind. A man makes his way to t chopper, pulls the door open: LaPiere.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: looks up. The cockpit is filled with an operatic aria. Turning it down:

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: Dodge reports the Conlan woman is moving against him. He thinks its the main force. He doesn't think he can hold... They could be here in two hours.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: You tell Dodge he has to hold! Get every hand to stand by. We'll wait for Garth to (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 85.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: REICH (cont'd) radio in, but one way or the other, we're taking Casa Vincent tonight!

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: provides a landing spot for Garth's body. His equipment l nearby. Diana's image seems to sit down beside him. After a momen recovery:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You're on my side now, is that the idea?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Is that all you've come to do, steal? Garth considers the question a moment.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Vincent was supposedly on the verge of a discovery that would return the earth to its original weather pattern. Do you know anything about that? No.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That secret is supposed to be contained in Vincent's computer... in you.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'm not the computer. I just live in it... But no, I'm not aware of anything like that.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Can you access the computer?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: There were things Mr. Vincent didn't want me to know... business secrets, accounting spreadsheets, his personal correspondence. Other things.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Look. Diana's eyes shut. When they open: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 86.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Nothing about any research on weather. There are vast amounts of files that are encrypted.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Can you decrypt them? Diana would rather not answer the question. She's obfuscating:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No... I can't.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Maybe I can...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No. You wouldn't stand a chance. Let me take you to the earthquake supplies. There must be a ton of food. It's located in the subbasement. Garth realizes that she's holding back. He stands, gather his equipment.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's this way... But Garth strides out in the opposite direction, deeper i the residence.

dialogues.speaker: WALK WITH GARTH
dialogues.text: as Diana comes up to parallel him.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You're going the wrong way. Garth slams through the doors leading to a corridor. On the left, the armory, behind locked doors.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ARMORY
dialogues.text: cool as a mausoleum in the shadowy dark, where there are upon row of weapons systems, dormant but operable.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 87.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: presses on.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You mustn't go in there. Garth ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you go in there you'll set off the final defensive system! Listen to me!

dialogues.speaker: THE DOUBLE DOORS
dialogues.text: are massive. A sign reads: EnCrypt. Garth drops his pack, removes the notebook computer, begi picking the locks.

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: swing open. Diana stands in Garth's way.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Please... I'm begging you, don't... Garth pushes through her.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER ROOM IS VAST
dialogues.text: A machine of a million parts, pulsing, alive, a sentient thinking machine. At its center is a couch preformed to accommodate the hum body. In it, THE CORPSE OF A MAN.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: stands by the corpse. Garth approaches, stunned. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 88.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Vincent? Yes.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me what happened. Tears well in her eyes. She fights them.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I... murdered him.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Why? Diana looks away. Moments fall like broken glass to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a shout)

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Over the months that he was a recluse here, he... changed. I know why now. He never told me about the collapse... out there. He never said, "Diana, the world is ending." I thought Mr. Vincent had accepted the fact that I wasn't attracted to him...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: sits working at a computer station, fingers rippling acro the keyboard. He stops. DIANA PROJECTS nearby.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Mr. Vincent, you asked for me? Vincent turns to look at her appraisingly, foot to head.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: There's just the two of us now, Diana...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Sir? Thoughts cascade through his mind and out onto his expression. Finally: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: What are you wearing? Diana looks down at herself. Tunic. Slacks.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Business clothes. As usual.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: Take them off. Stunned, for some moments Diana can say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Mr. Vincent, this wasn't part of our agreement. Vincent's fingers return to the keyboard. DIANA'S CLOTHES DISAPPEAR.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME DIANA IN PRESENT
dialogues.text: as she recounts the story to Garth.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I was a disembodied human being... Vincent could recreate me any way he wanted inside the computer... make me do things... make me feel things... Even so, it wasn't enough.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: types data into EnCrypt.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S NARRATION
dialogues.text: Vincent intended to transfer his consciousness into the computer, to bring us together. Diana pleads with Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Don't do this! You'll die!

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: (cynically) Sweet Diana — always the humanitarian! What you don't know — I'm dead already! But in there... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor 89. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 90

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VINCENT (cont'd) (gestures EnCrypt) ++. I'll be immortal and I'1l have you forever!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S NARRATION
dialogues.text: I knew by this time what he meant by ‘have' me. He would rape and debase me for all eternity. Finishing the preparations, Vincent lies down on the recliner, pulls the pincer nodes down so they touch his b

dialogues.speaker: DIANA'S NARRATION, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vincent allowed me full control of the operational functions of EnCrypt... so I overloaded the system. I murdered him... The EnCrypt MACHINE GOES WILD, SPARKS FLITTING. Vincent fries.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME PRESENT
dialogues.text: continues to remember the night she killed Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You didn't murder him... You protected yourself. Justifiable homicide. Diana listens. She's not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'll help you get what you want, just... you have to promise me something.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: When you're done... you'll kill me. (on Garth's searching look:) I've been alone for twenty years. I can't stand to be alone any longer, so kill me.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: That was the plan from the beginning... Show me how to access Vincent's files.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH OPENS VINCENT'S DEAD HAND
dialogues.text: to reveal a detailed tattoo. Diana watches from five paces away. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 91.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Put it palm down on the scanner. The system requires both the image and a DNA match. His DNA may be dusty, but it's there. Garth must twist Vincent's body out of the couch for the to reach the nearby scanner. A band of light reads the drawing.

dialogues.speaker: A 3-D PROJECTION OF A COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: fills the room. File names scroll down. Garth approaches the screen. Bars of light like venetian blinds cross his features.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Do any of these names mean anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Do a 'Search.' These are Vincent's files. I can't do it for you. Garth faces the keyboard, types in SEARCH:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Search for what?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Try ‘weather.' Garth types in WEATHER.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT ARMORY
dialogues.text: one green, one yellow, rest above an empty container. The LIQUIDS SUDDENLY EMPTY into the container, mixing. Three LASER BEAMS JET OUT to warm the liquid. The liquid begins to move.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: watches new files list on the screen. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 92.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Here we go. Diana looks over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Wait. What's that? She points.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCROLLING WORDS
dialogues.text: among many others: PRAETOR

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What's Praetor?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Not what — who. My doctor. Bring up the file. Garth types in PRAETOR and presses RETURN.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: sit at a table. DR. PRAETOR is a man whose persona sings confidence and believability. Vincent looks 20 years youn than he did in Diana's last recounting.

dialogues.speaker: PRAETOR
dialogues.text: Let's get right down to it — I won't do this.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: PRAETOR
dialogues.text: You damn well know what I mean. Diana Logan. This is tantamount to murder. It's unethical and I won't be a part of it. Vincent's gaze drifts about, looking for a camera... unti looks DIRECTLY AT YOU. Vincent smiles. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 93.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: I'm aware that you're recording this.

dialogues.speaker: PRAETOR
dialogues.text: I won't do it!

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: You will bring me the disc.

dialogues.speaker: PRAETOR
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong with her!

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: You'll bring me the disc... or you'll pay the price!

dialogues.speaker: PRAETOR
dialogues.text: She's not sick! She's not going to die!

dialogues.speaker: BRING IT TO ME
dialogues.text: The recording ends.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH WATCHES AS DIANA
dialogues.text: staggers back.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: There was nothing wrong with me... Diana looks over at Vincent's mummified cadaver, hand reaching out as if beckoning for her.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were right... You were right!

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Diana...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: He murdered me... I was a young woman. I wanted children. I wanted a life...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You took your revenge on him.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No... NO! He deserved what I did to him. I didn't deserve THIS! The hollow SOUND of the computer lab echoes her words. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 94.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT ARMORY
dialogues.text: is forming in the vat. Amoeba-like. Constantly changing. tentacle becomes an arm... becomes a hand reaching for th lid... pushes it away... it clatters to the floor... the beast rises.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: stands alone in the cavernous room. Diana is gone. Shaken gradually turns to the computer. Garth reviews more files. One catches his attention: CONGRESS. Garth activates it.

dialogues.speaker: THE PROJECTION OF VINCENT
dialogues.text: that Garth stares up at is twice life-size. Vincent's luxurious office can be seen behind him.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT'S IMAGE
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen of Congress... the plan you are about to review, if implemented, will return the earth's weather pattern to what it was forty years ago... Vincent Industries has invested countless hours... (shared amusement) — and my substantial fortune — in developing a new kind of flora, a plant with an unusual by-product...

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT ARMORY
dialogues.text: overflows the vat and lands with a splat onto the floor. begins to undulate.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: continues to observe the Vincent presentation. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 95

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT'S IMAGE
dialogues.text: +-. a hydroflourocarbon-eating micro- organism transmitted by the wind and capable of returning the ozone layer to its previous state within a decade. Once the ozone layer is re-established...

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT ARMORY
dialogues.text: pauses at a door, its pulsating globular flesh hesitant... before it rises and reshapes itself into an imperfect mim of a human being.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: watches Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT'S IMAGE
dialogues.text: ++. global warming will be reduced, and gradually the storms which have plagued our planet will decline in potency... (etc. ) DIANA APPEARS beside Garth.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: John, something's coming.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What? What something?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I don't know. I've never seen it before.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT'S IMAGE
dialogues.text: The glaciation which has increased in recent years in the far northern and southern hemispheres due to the increased cloud cover will...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What do you mean you've never seen it before? Diana has no answer.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: In the armory. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 96.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT'S IMAGE
dialogues.text: ++. gradually recede. Now there is a price to be paid for these miracles. The Vincent plant will affect agriculture. The plant is aggressive and can't discern between wild and cultivated land...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: What does it look like?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Like a man... then not.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Let me see it. Diana sends the video feed to a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: stands like a man before the door, barely seen in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: stare at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: It's a man. Suddenly the creature TRANSMORPHS into something ghastly inhuman, and reforms as a man.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vincent has another weapons system, one you don't know about.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Well, fuck him!

dialogues.speaker: THE GALLERIES
dialogues.text: open and disgorge flying miniature helicopters, ghosts, t and robots which move quickly in a single direction.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 97.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW THE CHOPPERS
dialogues.text: as they careen through the galleries... down the corridor toward the elevator... bank left down the stairwell... an into the residence. Ghosts, tanks and robots follow.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT ARMORY
dialogues.text: flings a globular portion of itself at the door. The door BEGINS TO CHANGE, RIPPLING AND UNDULATING... the opens itself before collapsing. The globular residue retu to Mother.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: retrieves his rifle and equipment as Vincent's projected image continues its presentation.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT'S IMAGE
dialogues.text: --. lack of concentrated crops means a decline in yield of over fifty percent lasting for more than two decades. However, this change is temporary. The new plant has been bio-engineered to self- destruct after thirty generations... Garth sees that Diana is standing absolutely still, her e staring far off, elsewhere, directing the battle in the armory.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT ARMORY
dialogues.text: turns as dozens of miniature helicopters veer into the ro and head for it. The CREATURE DISSOLVES TO THE FLOOR and separates into do of smaller globules, which dash for every corner of the r

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: reaches out to almost touch Diana.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Diana? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 98.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: THE VINCENT ARMORY
dialogues.text: fire at the small globular creatures, which respond by flinging portions of themselves back.

dialogues.speaker: A CHOPPER
dialogues.text: is slimed by the Ameobic creature. The chopper begins to alter immediately. Its blades warp and slow, its metal sa and it drops from the sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATTLE
dialogues.text: The choppers FIRE. PULSE BEAMS CRISS-CROSS THE ROOM. The AMOEBAS FLING BACK. Ghosts join the melee. Robots and tanks wheel into the room.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: stands in a trance, concentrating every resource at commanding the battle.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT'S IMAGE
dialogues.text: +». small price to pay for a return to a normal Earth in less than fifty years — one trillion dollars... in gold... in advance.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT ARMORY
dialogues.text: continues to rage. CHOPPERS CAREEN AND CRASH. GHOSTS HOVE

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: the final chopper crashes. The final ghost falls from the air. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 99.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: AN AMOEBA
dialogues.text: joins another. Then another. Then another.

dialogues.speaker: THE CENTER OF THE ROOM
dialogues.text: where the beast rejoins and rises into a mockery of a hum being, imperfect as Frankenstein's monster, ghastly.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: eyes focus on the here and now.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I failed.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT'S IMAGE
dialogues.text: Now I know that Congress is busy currently... Cities are burning... there's rioting in the streets... but I must demand an immediate response.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I watched on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It's coming, John.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT'S IMAGE
dialogues.text: I am prepared on notice of your commitment to release a billion bio- engineered seeds into the next passing storm... Garth turns back to the computer station.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Did he release the seeds?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'm locked out. Release his data to me. Here, input this command. Large symbols appear in front of Vincent's projected face Garth inputs the code. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 100.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT'S IMAGE
dialogues.text: I await your confirmation... File names reel up past Vincent. THE FILES BEGIN TO OPEN,

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: The seed pods are located on the roof... They haven't been activated.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: The federal government collapsed before it could respond... Why didn't he release them? Diana doesn't say.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a shout)

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Because the bastard wasn't paid!

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: He allowed the world to be destroyed... because he wasn't paid? Diana's expression almost asks: He allowed me to die, did he?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Maybe there's something wrong with the seeds. Check his data.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: John, the creature is approaching...

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I DON'T CARE!... Check the files. Diana's eyes close. The HUM of the great computer's synap circuits fills the room. ON THE PROJECTED SCREEN, file na stream down at an unreadable rate. Graphs, blueprints, representations of the new plant's DNA flicker into and o of existence. Then: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 101.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: According to the research, the new bio- engineered plant should work as advertised.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Release the seeds! Now!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: John, the creature is just outside that door. Garth rushes the command console.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: I'll do it! Show me how! Diana pulls her gaze away from the door just as its color begins to change.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I can't. It's a temporary device. Vincent didn't integrate it with the rest of the systems. You'll have to set it off manually, from the roof.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: changes color, ripples, opens as it sags. The amoebic globules that deteriorated the door reunite with the creature.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER ROOM, (SCENE)
dialogues.text: react as the creature slithers/walks into the room. The creature struggles to hold its human form, twisting, undulating until... VINCENT'S EVIL GRIN appears on its fa Startled, Diana almost screams. Garth switches his rifle to full auto and sprays the amoe causing it to splatter against the far wall.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: It was Vincent! But Diana sees this awful creature for what it is.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No... Vincent must have used a subset of his own DNA to create it. Nothing that (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 102.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DIANA (cont'd) small could carry the entire consciousness of a human being. The amoeba begins to reform, the splattered matter oozing across the dark floor and down the distant walls to reassemble.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Diana — stairs to the roof?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Far end of the room. Go! Garth grabs his equipment, turns to leave:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Shut off the surface to air missile batteries on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Just do it! Diana gestures assent. They share a brief moment eye-to-e then Garth turns and rushes for the far reaches of the hu room.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: turns to face the reforming creature. She disappears and shoebox rushes for the amorphous biomass slithering towar her. The shoebox slugs into the mass and is swallowed whole.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: slides to a stop beside the door, twists its knob, finds locked and jams his survival knife deep into the wood of jamb. It splinters. Garth rises and slams through the door.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: reels through the door and up the stairs. There is a another door at the next landing blocking his path.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 103.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: undulates toward the open door to the stairs, moving with incredible speed.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL DOOR
dialogues.text: stabs his survival knife into the door, smashing the wood

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL LOWER LANDING
dialogues.text: oozes through the door... THEN SPURTS A PORTION OF ITSELF the well. Where Garth has just slammed the door behind him. The ooze lands on the door and begins to commingle with i

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: wedges the survival blade into the jamb, securing the doo Garth quickly ascends the steps to the next landing. Below, THE DOOR GARTH SECURED BEGINS TO WAFFLE, its constituents weakened by contact with the creature. It sa open and the creature enters.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE NEXT LANDING
dialogues.text: blows the doorknob off the door just as A SMATTERING OF G thrown from below SPLATTERS ONTO HIS BODY ARMOR WITH A HI Garth ignores the goo and leaps through the door to the f landing below the roof.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: begins to "slinky" up the steps toward the gaping door.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEXT LANDING
dialogues.text: staggers to a stop as the GOO SLIDES UP OVER HIS EYES.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 104.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH'S EYES
dialogues.text: reveal that the SPARKLING BODY ARMOR IS KEEPING THE GOO INCHES AWAY from really contacting him.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME GARTH
dialogues.text: as he stabs his fingers through the goo, trying to remove from blocking his sight. He reaches for a battery from his pack, finds the last on pulls it, SPITS ON ITS CONTACTS AND THEN RAMS IT INTO THE Goo. The GOO SHRIEKS AND LEAPS AWAY. Garth pulls the hand radio from his pack.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (radio) Reich, come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reich returns to the chopper to take the mike.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: (radio) Garth, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth leaps through the door onto the roof. The STORM IS ALMOST UNBEARABLE. Above the noise of the wind:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (radio) Reich, bring your people in! Reich throws LaPiere a 'I told you so' look.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Okay! Let's go! You heard the man.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 105.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: surveys the roof looking for the seeding devices.

dialogues.speaker: THE SEEDING DEVICES
dialogues.text: are globes twenty feet across located at each corner of t roof.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: moves for the closest globe as, in the distance, Reich's chopper begins to wing in. Garth opens the control panel.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL PANEL
dialogues.text: where a remote activation device is imbedded beside the programing keys.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: takes the remote controller out, snaps it onto his belt, studies the seeding device controls as Reich's chopper la near the center of the roof. Reich, LaPiere and six men with weapons exit the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: You did it!

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: The last defensive device is coming up those stairs right now. Send your people to take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: (gesturing to LaPiere) Go! LaPiere and the six men move for the stairwell.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 106.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: slam open the stairwell door and fire on full automatic i the pit. Once everyone has emptied one clip, they reload descend.

dialogues.speaker: REICH OBSERVES GARTH
dialogues.text: as he prepares to activate the controls.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: You were right. Vincent developed a way to fix the weather. I'm setting the timers that will blow the roof and seed the incoming storm. Reich thinks about this a moment.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: No shit? Reverse the weather?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: allows the troops to take the point as they descend. The lead trooper runs into THE AMEOBIC CREATURE, WHICH ENVELOPES HIM. Blinded, his body armor sparking, the sold spins madly, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: Back off! Back off! He and the remaining troops retreat up five steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reich watches Garth type in '5:00' in the timer.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You're not going to activate it, are you?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Of course I'm going to activate it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 107.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Don't you realize what this is, you idiot?! This is more than wealth — this is power!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: and the remaining troops watch as the SOLDIER IS CONSUMED THE AMOEBIC CREATURE. His skin turns powder-white before is spat out like a dust devil to the floor below.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: Kill it! Shoot it! Shoot it! They OPEN FIRE, FULL AUTOMATIC.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: stare at one another, Garth's finger poised above the activate button.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: All I'm asking is... just think about this a minute, will you?... We could evac all this equipment up to the Central Coast and set it off when the time is right. We could... reunite the country. Hell, the entire goddamn world.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: With you as emperor, I suppose? Reich grins. Emperor is too strong a word... Garth presses the ‘activate’ button, bringing this globe line.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: and his remaining men RETREAT UP THE STEPS AS THEY FIRE. The ROUNDS SPLATTER THE CREATURE for seconds before it reunites. The creature FLINGS A PORTION OF ITSELF UP THE STAIRWELL, CONNECTING WITH A SOLDIER. He screams in fear, the goo beginning to eat through his body armor. LaPiere reaches past his men to shove the wounded man at creature below, to buy time. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 108.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: (gesturing up) Let's go, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: ROOF
dialogues.text: runs for the next machine as Reich follows him, pleading.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Look, look... I'm not a greedy guy. We'll do it your way. Any way you want.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: My way is now.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: No! No, don't you see, there's no margin in that. We can't use that. Garth opens the next controller, taps the 'on' button, be to program.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: is the last to be slimed. Men below him are already burni being eaten by the goo flung by the mother creature.

dialogues.speaker: LAPIERE
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, goddamn it! LaPiere peels the body armor belt off. The goo sticks to electromagnetic shield. LaPiere tosses it into the darkne below and retreats up.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: is almost out the door when the amoebic CREATURE SLAPS ON HIM, PULLING HIM BELOW. LaPiere begins to bellow and cry, shrieking with fear.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: fires his automatic pistol at the sky, stopping Garth, wh turns slowly to face him.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: Let's be reasonable... You're alone. I have troops. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 109.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garth's expression says, I wouldn't be so sure...

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to help mankind, too. Just like you. But at the right time. If we set it off now, no one can take credit, but if we wait, spread the word, rally people to our side, and then set it off — there's no limit to how strong we can become.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: No. Now.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: No. Later. When I say so. Garth shakes his head 'no.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're a tough nut, Major... Something slaps Reich behind his head. What's that? Keepi the weapon aimed at Garth, HE REACHES BACK WITH HIS LEFT HAND, FEELS SOMETHING ON HIS SKIN, brings the fingers bef his eyes so he can see.

dialogues.speaker: REICH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell? Garth pivots and runs.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD SEEDING DEVICE
dialogues.text: slides home, flips open the controller and begins tapping the activation delay. Behind him, in the distant backgrou REICH SPINS MADLY, SCREAMING. Garth activates the device, then stands. Reich's VOICE GOES SUDDENLY SILENT. Now there's only Garth and the creature left on the roof. And one remaining pod to be programed. Garth leaps into a run toward it.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 110.

dialogues.speaker: RUN WITH GARTH
dialogues.text: as he jumps cables and ventilators. In the distant, and t less so distant background unidentified items are tossed the air as the creature approaches quickly. Garth freezes.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE, (SCENE)
dialogues.text: slowly undulates up into a mound, then a miniature peak, a crude mimic of humanity, and finally into a monster of man. Vincent's awful face draws into a smile. Garth draws the Smith and Wessons and BEGINS FIRING, leap away. A PORTION OF THE CREATURE, JUST FLUNG, SPLATS against a r brace behind where Garth stood and slithers down. The creature LOSES VISCOSITY AS THE STREAM OF BULLETS HIT and it collapses. Garth leaps across the puddle and runs on.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOURTH POD
dialogues.text: drops to his knees, opens the control box and begins programing the device. A dark form rises behind him. Garth accidentally programs in '50:00' rather than '5:00' Cursing:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! Goddamn it! He must start all over again. The form behind him is larger. Finished, Garth stands. He notices the dark form behind h He turns.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 111.

dialogues.speaker: REICH
dialogues.text: stands there, HALF HIS BODY CHALK, SHAKING WITH THE CERTA OF HIS DEATH. He reaches out an arm at Garth but it falls like a cigarette ash, to the floor and disintegrates. What remains of his living flesh turns chalk-white and disintegrates TO REVEAL:

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: standing behind him. Goo from REICH'S BODY DRIBBLES AWAY, THEN SCOOTS to the Mother Goo.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: retreats a step, removes the remote control from his pock presses the ‘activate button' and tosses it into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONTROLLER PANELS
dialogues.text: light up and begin a countdown from 5:00.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SCENE
dialogues.text: as Garth takes a step to the left. But the creature ignores him, looking instead toward the

dialogues.speaker: THE TIMER
dialogues.text: continues to count down: 4:33... 4:32... 4:31... 4:30...

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SCENE
dialogues.text: as Garth waves his hands at the creature, trying to draw attention away from the pod.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey! This way, slime ball! The creature looks at him briefly, then moves for the pod (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 112.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The creature FLINGS A WAD OF ITSELF at the pod timer mechanism. The MECHANISM BEGINS TO CHANGE, darken, weaken.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: leaps to the pod, breaks a faceplate, stabs ACTIVATE NOW.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: leaps away.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPLOSION
dialogues.text: sends the pod ball high into the sky, where it BURSTS APA sending the seeds gusting high into the wind.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: runs for the next pod. He slides headfirst into the mechanism, pops the cover open and breaks the face plate. Finger on the ACTIVATE NOW button, Garth looks back over shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: undulates toward him like a shark smelling blood.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME GARTH
dialogues.text: as he presses the button and moves.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: FLINGS ITSELF at the pod just as it EXPLODES. The pod ball rises into the sky, repeating the previous EXPLOSION.  EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 113.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: is running for the next pod when the flying goo SLAPS HIM THE SHOULDERS and back. The goo causes the BODY ARMOR TO SPARK. Garth checks his wrist read-out:

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: reaches for another battery in his belt. Empty. Garth hits the buckle, snapping the armor loose, and thro it aside, the GOO CLINGING TO IT as it falls away.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD POD
dialogues.text: nearly falls over it, drops to a knee, opens the cover, smashes the faceplate and presses the ACTIVATE NOW button The pod BLOWS just as Garth leaps away.

dialogues.speaker: THE SEEDS
dialogues.text: are whipped up and away by the stiffening wind.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: removes the last two clips for the pistols, loads one, th the other. He stares off across the roof.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: is making its way toward the final pod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: draws the Smith-and-Wessons and advances. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 114.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garth begins FIRING ON FULL AUTOMATIC as he runs. The BULLETS DISPERSE THE CREATURE. Goo flies everywhere. Garth reaches the pod first, opens the cover, smashes the faceplate.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE'S
dialogues.text: amorphous tentacles grip Garth and pull him back. His reaching hand is jerked away from the ACTIVATE NOW button. Garth bellows in pain as the GOO ABSORBS INTO HIS SKIN. W blotches begin to appear. Garth's boot catches a cable line and holds as the creatu pulls on his prone body. Garth reaches for a pen in his pocket. It's the miniature crossbow seen earlier. Arms spring out, a trigger. The bo snaps into place with a flick of his wrist. Garth aims... aims... and fires.

dialogues.speaker: THE POD CONTROLLER
dialogues.text: is pressed home by the flying bolt.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH AND THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: are blown back by the explosion. Garth lands ten feet away. The GOO IS SLOWLY PROCEEDING U ONE ARM, changing his flesh, killing it. Garth rubs it, a to return circulation, but it doesn't help. Garth sees the creature reforming, moving toward him. He tries to move but he's been hurt far more than he thought sags, waiting death.

dialogues.speaker: A DAMAGED ROBOT
dialogues.text: from an earlier confrontation with the creature surges forward. In its hands, a cable whose end has been strippe revealing naked wires. The robot spears the creature with cable. SPARKS AND SIZZLING FLESH. Moments pass as the CREATURE CONTINUES TO LOSE VISCOSITY, sagging finally int bags of amorphous jelly, and then decayed pools of chemic (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 115.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Diana APPEARS, imperfectly due to damaged projector lense on top of the robot, which drops the cable.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (coughing) I'm dying.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No you're not. I can save you.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH
dialogues.text: (laughs - bubbling blood) No. I don't think so. The robot scoops him up, pivots and moves for the stairwe door, DIANA PROJECTED ON TOP and seeming to tend to Garth

dialogues.speaker: THE TRACKS OF THE ROBOT
dialogues.text: pass over puddles of ooze, which cling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robot carrying Garth, crazily descends the steps, dropping from step to step. Smashes through the second landing door. Crashes through the third. Careens around the corner and through the final door.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROBOT'S TRACKS
dialogues.text: are beginning to SMOKE AND HISS as the creature transform the metal.

dialogues.speaker: GARTH AND DIANA
dialogues.text: almost tumble from the robot as it throws a track and gri to a halt. Garth's left arm is almost ash. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 116.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You must get up!... Get up!... Get up, goddamn it! GET UP! Garth is almost out. He looks questioningly at Diana, as to ask, Why?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get to the computer! John, listen to me, you can still live... if you just get to the computer! Garth understands. He tries to lift himself from the robo arms, falls back, tries again. Garth tumbles to the floor, tries to stand but his LEFT L HAS BEEN CONVERTED TO WASTE MATERIAL. No living flesh the

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Focus, John! Focus on me. You can do it. DIANA'S IMAGE FLICKERS in the darkness, a wavering ghost. is tethered to the damaged robot, unable to go with him. Garth begins to crawl. DIANA DISAPPEARS FROM THE ROBOT and REAPPEARS, A BETTER PROJECTION, near the computer where Vincent's lifeless bo lays.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fifteen feet, John. That's all it is. Just fifteen feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: surges through the door. Diana snaps around to look, as does Garth. The creature too is not what it once was. The beast fight retain its form and motion, but moves forward. Garth tries to crawl faster, but can't. DIANA DISAPPEARS from the computer, and REAPPEARS at the robot. Standing on its top, she directs it to turn around The remaining track spins the machine around. Garth forces himself to go faster. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnCrypt by Richard Taylor 117.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Diana commands the robot's arms to snap menacingly. This the only weapon that remains. The creature advances. Garth uses furniture to pull himself forward. He's on his knees now. The robot's arms snap as the creature advances. The robot and creature meet. The snapping arms are meaningless. The CREATURE SWALLOWS THE ROBOT as DIANA'S I WAVERS, CRACKLES, AND DISAPPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
